loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 53-year-old married woman with 3 children, 2 attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lydia has had a shirt printing business for 21 years and requests 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase paints and shirts.

 In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase paints and  shirts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a fishing business for 30 years.

She requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets.

In the future, Nancy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Deditha

texts.en:
Deditha works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish. Deditha has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Deditha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer soltera y madre de 4 hijos, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 14 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00.  

Adriana sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco y ha intentado mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriana is a single mother of four children.  She is a hardworking and responsible person.  She worked with her family at different businesses where she acquired sales experience.

Fourteen years ago, she started a grocery store so she could work independently.  She works from 7:00 am until 10:00.  

Adriana dreams of having a supermarket in the future.  She is requesting a loan to acquire a larger variety of products at wholesale, including greens, grains, fruits, and vegetables.  She will be able to provide her customers with products of excellent quality.

This business has helped her move forward little by little and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise including greens, grains, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Zeribaberi

texts.en:
Zeribaberi is a 51-year-old hard working married man with four children.  They  live in Kamwenge Uganda. 

He raises  livestock as his main source of income. He started these businesses with the intention of improving  his income and standard of living. He hopes to own a big farm. His main challenges are inadequate capital and changing weather. 

He requests a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 44ans, Akossiwa vit à Lomé dans le quartier Baguida ; elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants ; elle vend des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures depuis 1999 et vend au grand marché de Lomé, et s’approvisionne quatre (04) fois par mois. Elle n’est pas scolarisée, se nourrit deux fois par jours et n’a pas de moyen de transport, mais dispose d’un poste de radio et de télévision pour s’informer en langues locales. Akossiwa souhaiterait un appui financier pour renforcer son commerce afin de mieux épargner, s’inscrire dans les cours d’alphabétisation et en plus améliorer son niveau de vie, et au mieux subvenir aux divers besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 44, Akossiwa lives in Lomé in the Baguida neighborhood; she is married and the mother of three children. She has been selling cosmetics and shoes since 1999 and sells them in a market in Lomé. She adds to her inventory four times a month. She did not attend school, eats two meals a day, and has no means of transport but she owns a radio and a television to keep abreast of the news in local languages.  

Akossiwa would like a loan to bolster her little business so as to be able to put aside more in savings, sign up for literacy classes, improve her living standard, and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy six dozen shoes so she can sign up for literacy classes with her extra income.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a new client to the institution. He is single and still stays with his parents.

Ronald completed the senior four school level, but after that his parents couldn’t take him for further studies as a result of lack of funds. He therefore decided to start coffee trading with the little money he had since he could easily get the coffee within his village.

Ronald applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to add capital to his business and increase his income. He hopes to expand his business using the loan money. He is working hard so that he can support his parents and siblings.

Ronald has a dream of setting up his own house and setting up his home. He thanks UGAFODE for financial assistance which he hopes will boost his business and help him to break out of the poverty camp.

loans.use: to buy coffee for trading

loans.name: Ayde De Jesus

texts.es:
Ayde siempre tiene su mente ocupada pensando en alternativas para ganarse la vida y obtener recursos para facilitar el sostenimiento de su hogar compuesto por sus 3 hijos, aunque estos ya son mayores de edad, ella no deja de lado su responsabilidad y cariño como madre.

Tiene un pequeño negocio en el cual se dedica a la fabricación de escobas y trapeadoras, estos elementos los vende de manera ambulante por las calles del municipio de La Dorada.

Sus hijos son una ayuda muy grande a la hora de vender estos elementos y por eso se ha convertido en un negocio familiar.

Hoy en día desea capitalizar su negocio y solicita un préstamo para comprar elementos como madera y materiales para la fabricación de escobas.

Con este préstamo podrá tener los materiales disponibles y podrá sostener su pequeña actividad.
texts.en:
Ayde has always had a busy mind, thinking of alternatives to earn a living and get resources to be able to support her home. Her family is made up of 3 children, and although they are already older, she did not leave behind her responsibility and love as a mother. She has a small business where she makes a living making brooms and mops. These items are made out of wood and sold traveling through the streets of La Dorada township.

Her children are a big help when it is time to sell these products. For that reason, it has become a family business. Nowadays, she hopes to capitalize on her business and request a loan to buy things such as wood and materials for broom-making. With this loan, she will have the available materials and will be able to maintain this small business.

loans.use: to buy items like like wood and other materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is aged thirty-two and married with two children ages six and three. Both attend school.

She operates a drug shop in Hoima, Uganda with the dream of expanding her drug shop and educating her children. She will use the loan money to buy more drugs to sell. Harriet usually complains of competition from government hospitals that offer free services.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une jeune femme mariée et sans enfant ; âgée de 23 ans, elle est dans la localité de Baguida et vend des objets plastiques au grand marché de Lomé depuis 2013 en s’approvisionnant huit (08) fois par mois. Elle est logé dans une habitation dont le toit est couvert de tôle, se nourrit deux fois par jours, se soigne par automédication et dort sous une moustiquaire. Amélé sollicite un financement pour soutenir son activité génératrice de revenu afin d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire, mieux épargner et aider son marie dans les dépenses internes.
texts.en:
Amélé is a young 23-year-old woman who is married and has no children. She lives in Baguida and has been selling plastic goods at the Lomé Grand Market since 2013. She procures her goods eight times a month. 

She lives in a house with a sheet metal roof, eats twice a day, takes care of her own health needs, and sleeps under a mosquito net.

She is seeking a loan to support her business so she can increase her profits, save better, and help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy three coolers, one dozen basins, and three buckets

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is a Palestinian refugee, who has been working hard in an aluminum factory for 13 years to make sure he can provide for his family. In addition to his job in the factory, he runs his own aluminum business, where he makes kitchen aluminum closets and requested home needs to increase his family's income and provide his children with a brighter future.

Ali requested his fifth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to purchase necessary aluminum accessories to develop his own business and make sure he can meet the increasing customers needs. He has a very good reputation in his region and domain. His previous loans were also invested in developing his business, so that one day he can stop being an employee and work on developing and expanding his own business.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum accessories to develop his own business a

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: La señora Feliciana y su esposo Félix, son personas mayores, que trabajan día a día para darles mejores condiciones a sus tres hijos pequeños, que aun asisten a la escuela para tener una mejor educación y darles la formación que ellos no recibieron. A base de esfuerzo lograron tener una casa propia que es de construcción rustica ubicada en Tiraque. Los señores se dedican a la producción agrícola, entre los cultivos que más producen están la papa y el haba en vaina verde, actualmente la señora solicita un crédito para compra de un terreno agrícola que está cerca de su domicilio, para así poder ampliar su producción y de alguna manera incrementar sus ingresos para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Feliciana and her husband Felix are mature people who work day in and day out to provide better conditions of life for their three small children who are attending school in order to receive a better education, acquiring the preparation their parents never received. Through the parents' efforts, they have their own house, of rustic construction, located in Tiraque. 

The couple work in agricultural production. The crops they cultivate that are most productive are potatoes and green beans. 

Now, Feliciana is requesting a loan to purchase a piece of agricultural land near their home, so that she can expand production and, to some degree, increase her income to benefit the family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of agricultural land to increase her production.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 41 years old and married with three children. Her two children are currently in school and Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. Rosemarie has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. and earns additional income from her motorcycle transport business. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis Lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged thirty-one, married and has four children. Three of his children attend school. 

Denis runs a beauty salon and he hopes to grow his business to greater heights. He will use the loan facility to buy more machines for shaving the hair.

loans.use: to buy more machines for shaving the hair.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre de 40 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza alternadamente con su trabajo como jornalero en otras fincas y es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Jhon is 40 years old.  He is a loving father and a farmer.  Since his income is not enough to meet his household expenses, he started another business that he alternates with his work as a laborer on other farms.  He raises and sells pigs that he fattens so that he can improve his family's quality of life.  As the head of the household, he is responsible for all of the household expenses, and there is not much money left to invest in his business.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to fatten and feed for them so that he can improve his sales and drive his business forward.  He will be more active with his small business and make it more attractive to customers since he will have more pigs to sell.

His dream is to be able to generate good income so that his family does not want for any necessities, since he lived like that and it affected him a lot.  For this reason, he works tirelessly for his children and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten and feed for them so that he can improve his sales.

loans.name: Asmar Al- Kadesia Group

texts.en:
Asmar Al-Kadesia is a group which consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Khezaran is a 56 years old widow woman and a mother of five children. She is living with her children in a very misery condition. Khezaran is the sole breadwinner for her children. She works as a teacher in a private school with a very low salary, which is not enough to provide the children with the necessary needs. Her husband, who passed away several years ago, was the breadwinner of the family. Khezaran has now assumed all the responsibility for the children. 

Khezaran's house lacks the necessary furniture. She has applied for a loan of 70,000 YER to furnish her house with new furniture.
Khezaran hopes to renovate her old house, where she lives with her family, to be in a better condition.

loans.use: to furnish her house with new furniture.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba habite à Lomé au quartier Baguida ; elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants ; elle vend de la tomate et du poisson depuis 2001 au grand marché de Lomé, et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois dans le même marché. Ayaba vit dans une maison en location dont le toit est en tôle ; elle se nourrit deux fois par jours et n’a aucun moyen de déplacement, mais a un niveau d’étude primaire. Ainsi, Ayaba aimerait que lui soit accordée une assistance financière de microcrédit pour étendre son activité génératrice de revenu en vue d’augmenter son bénéfice et mieux épargner pour d’éventuelles charges qui peuvent survenir dans leur foyer.
texts.en:
Ayaba lives in Lomé in a neighborhood called Baguida; she is married and the mother of three children. She has been selling tomatoes  and  fish since 2001 in a marketplace in  Lomé, and she stocks up three times a month in the same market. 

 Ayaba lives in a rented house with a sheet metal roof. She has two meals a day and has no means of transport, but she attended primary school. 

Ayaba would like to be granted a micro-credit loan to expand her income-generating activity so as to grow her profit and be able to put aside more in savings for possible expenses that their household could incur.

loans.use: to buy three dozen bars of soap, three baskets of tomatoes, and three baskets of hot peppers, hoping to be able to put aside more in savings

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a current client and has had a  motorcyche taxi (boda boda) service  as his major source of income for 4 years.  He has two children who attend school.  

He rode someone else's motorcycle during his first 3 years of business and later joined Ugafode to request a loan to buy his own motorcycle. 

Dickson is applying for 2,000,000 UGX to finish his first house.  He will use this loan to buy iron sheets, bricks, cement, and doors. 

Dickson thanks Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled him to accumulate assets and he hopes to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Adjo habite à Baguida et est âgée de 35 ans ; elle fait le commerce des pagnes depuis 1999 et aussi des céréales et de la tomate qu’elle a entamé en 2009 ; elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois et vend en se déplaçant à l’intérieur du pays. Adjo et sa petite famille mangent deux fois par jours, elle n’a jamais fréquenté, mais elle a des connaissances du planning familial et dort sous une moustiquaire. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire le besoin de ses clients, d’aider son mari dans le paiement des frais scolaires de ses enfants, elle sollicite un financement de ses activités.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of three children, Adjo lives in Baguida and is 35 years old. She has been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] since 1999. In 2009 she also started selling cereals and tomatoes. She procures her goods twice a month and makes her sales in the interior of the country.

Adjo and her small family eat twice a day. She has not been [to school], but she knows about family planning. She sleeps under a mosquito net.

In order to satisfy her customers' needs and to help her husband with their children's school fees, she is seeking a loan to finance her business activities.

loans.use: to buy 32 baskets of corn, four baskets of beans, and eight baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a new client to the institution. Vicent was not able to attend school to earn a higher level of education due to financial constraints on his parents. He is married and he stays with his wife because he is a newlywed. He works in goat trading and this is his major source of income. He has been increasing his knowledge of the business over the last 3 years. He has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 to expand his business and earn additional profits. Vicent hopes to expand his business and achieve his dream of educating his children and to meet his entire family’s financial obligations by using the loan and sustaining his business. Vicent thanks UGAFODE for the financial help which it extends to low income earners.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Agbalè

texts.fr: Agbalè, âgée de 27 ans  est divorcée et mère deux enfants. Elle achète et revend du charbon de bois il y a 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes du quartier et revend à la devanture de sa maison. Elle vit Bè. Elle veut avec ce crédit acheter 5 sacs de charbons de bois. Agbalè est seule à faire face aux charges de la famille et ce crédit lui permettra d’avoir un revenu pour la suivie quotidien de sa famille et faire aussi face aux charges scolaires  de ses enfants qui sont à sa charge.
texts.en:
Agbalè is 27 years old, divorced, and a mother of two children. She has been buying and selling charcoal for 15 years. She lives in Bè.

She procures her goods from the wholesalers in the area and makes her sales from the front of her house.

She wants to have this loan to buy five sacs of charcoal. 

Agbalè is alone and must support her family by herself. This loan will allow her to have earnings that can support her family's everyday needs and also pay for her children's school fees, who are under her care.

loans.use: to buy five sacs of charcoal

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is a 40-year-old, married father of three children. He has been working hard, with his beloved wife's cooperation, to provide for their family with the necessary living needs. They are also responsible for providing for two additional family members.

Roland is a hard worker, well known in the tissues factory where he has been employed since July 2005. His limited income, combined with his wife's, isn't enough to cover the increasing living costs. Thus, for this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's school tuition fees. 

Roland hopes that one day he can open his own car wash garage and make sure that he can cover almost all of his family's needs in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en: Feruza lives with her family in a rural area. She is married and has 4 children. Feruza has been busy with animal husbandry for the past 5 years. She feeds 10 cows, 2 of which she uses for milking. Feruza sells milk to the locals and sells her cows at a local market. Her husband helps her to feed and sell the cows. In the future, Feruza is going to buy sheep to feed and then sell at the local market, because there is a great demand for them. Feruza lives with her family in a house that is in bad repair. She is going to repair her house and so she is asking for a loan of USD 2200 to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and soil as well as to pay for workers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and soil and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 31 years old and married. She has one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, who has a dried-fish-making business, in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fish, to make into dried fish.

Analiza has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make into dried fish.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, age 42, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in her business for five years, and she earns an additional income from food vending.

She and her husband have six children, three of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Melanie has borrowed and repaid one previous loan through NWTF, and she has now requested a second loan in the amount of PhP 15,000. She will use her loan funds to re-stock her store with items like soap, milk, and canned goods to offer for sale. 

Melanie aspires toward saving sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with items like soap, milk, and canned goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged twenty seven, married and has three children of ages 6, 4, and 1.

Musa deals in spare parts for motorcycles and this is supplemented by income from farming. He desires to expand and develop his business, however, inadequate capital hinders his desired dream. 

Musa will use the loan facility to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Johanna is 39 years old, and her three children are in school.

Johanna has a business buying and selling purchase order cards in the Philippines. Johanna requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers.

Johanna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Johanna would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yennyfer

texts.es:
Yennyfer, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para sus hijos de 9 y 2 años, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Ciudad Bolívar, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de sillas, mesas de trabajo, esmaltes de uñas de diferentes colores, exfoliantes y así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Yennyfer a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en:
Yennyfer, in her tireless search for a better life and better financial stability for her kids, of 9 and 2, started her own nail care and hair styling business.  She offers her services directly in clients' homes in the town of Ciudad Bolívar, a place where drive and tenacity is an important reference for the locals of the area. She works every day in varied schedules and is always busy offering different services as she is in big demand for her quality work. 

She is requesting economic support to buy chairs, work tables, nail polishes of different colors and exfoliating creams to then be able to offer a better service and maintain afloat her business. Today she feels happy with the good work which, up to now, she has achieved, which has allowed her to have more stable work.  With this loan you can help Yennyfer continue with her life project.

loans.use: to buy chairs, work tables, different color nail polishes and exfoliating creams

loans.name: Yoab

texts.en:
Yoab is an old client to the organization who has applied for a loan of UGX3,500,000. He runs a cow fattening business in Ruhega, a Northern Eastern division of the Rukungiri district. He has done this business for more than 10 years. The purpose of the loan is to buy more cows for trade so that he can raise money to maintain his family, pay school fees for his children and develop himself. 

Yoab is an honest and hardworking man but is always affected by limited capital. He faces many challenges like fluctuation of cows’ prices, cattle diseases and competition from other traders. However, his major problem is limited capital which hinders him from buying all the products his customers want. 

With this loan from UGAFODE, Yoab is hopeful that the situation will improve gradually. Yoab thanks the Kiva lenders, through Ugafode, for the financial support which has enabled him to finish his house and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu is a maize farmer from Rumi village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Saidu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saidu can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. When asked, Saidu said: “I would now be able to use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en: Bitrus is a maize farmer from Rumi village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Bitrus said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según él le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Montería, con el cual planea pagar sus estudios y colaborar con los gastos de su hogar en el que vive con sus padres.

Para esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo para la compra de un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de un joven Colombiano con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
José is in search of a promising future and good opportunities to move forward.  He decided to start a business that will give him everything that he has always dreamed of.

He is opening a grocery store in his home in the town of Montería.  With the profits, he plans to pay for his education and contribute to the household expenses that he shares with his parents.

In order to do this, he needs the help of a loan to purchase a cooler, shelves, display cases, and a stock of basic household products so he can stock and open his business.

Support the dreams of a young Colombian entrepreneur with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, shelving, display cases, and a stock of basic household items to start his business.

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy una joven madre de 29 años de edad que se encuentra muy motivada y emocionada ante la oportunidad que se le presenta en la vida y es que gracias a la corporación puede solicitar un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de heladería, un sueño que le había sido esquivo, pues al ser su primera experiencia crediticia era difícil acceder a este servicio con otras entidades.
 
Con el crédito solicitado comprara un congelador, surtido de helados, sillas, mesas para iniciar con su negocio.

Este crédito será de suma importancia para Leidy pues representa el principio de una vida como independiente.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young mother of 29 years who is very motivated and excited for this opportunity in life. It is thanks to this corporation that she can request a loan to start her own ice cream business, a dream which had been out of reach. Since this will be her first loan experience, it will be difficult to request from other entities. 

With the requested loan, she will buy a freezer, an assortment of ice cream, chairs, and tables to start her business. This loan will be of great importance to Leidy because it represents the start of her life as an independent.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, assortment of ice creams, seats, and tables to start her business.

loans.name: Laofary Group

texts.en: Tear's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from the local streams.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking, without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    Tear is excited that he, like the other members of his group, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. This is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne causes of disease.  Although some people in the villages, including Tear’s, are able to buy bottled water, having a water filter increases their disposable incomes by decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The water filter also benefits its users by decreasing the amount spent purchasing charcoal, and by decreasing the time spent foraging for wood.  The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filters, so his family can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sha'aibu

texts.en: Sha'aibu is a maize farmer from Dorayi village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sha'aibu would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sha'aibu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sha'aibu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food and farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Yalwa

texts.en: Yalwa is a maize farmer from the Furana district of Kaduna. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yalwa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yalwa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yalwa said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food and farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids in a small, humble house. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Hasan is also a student in a local university where he studies Arabic literature. He would like to take a BA degree and find a better job in the future.
 
Hasan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

Hasan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Gavharjon

texts.en:
Gavharjon is careful mother of 3 children. All of them are non-adults. Her husband is a kind man. 

Gavharjon, since childhood, has been a very hardworking girl. She began to work after her marriage. Then, she worked as a baker. She didn’t work during the past few years. One month ago she organized own business, dealing with baking and selling sambusas. She cooks the sambusas in her house and sells them in a local market. Gavharjon is going to develop her new business and, in this way, maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy big oven for baking her sambusas. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy big oven for baking sambusas, for developing her new business.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is a wonderful woman from a rural area. She is married and they have a young child. She is the main income earner in her family as her husband has a small income. It is very difficult for her to generate enough income for her family and all the necessary things they need, but she tries and works hard. She has been busy working in animal husbandry for more than 7 years now. She finds pleasure in working with animals. She was born and raised in the village, and this has allowed her great experience in the field. She buys animal at the local market and fattens them in her barn. After some months, she resells the animals at the market. Her husband and sister help her with the animals. She wants to increase the number of cattle. Currently she is asking for a loan TJS 7,000 to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira lives with her family in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is married and they are raising two children. Two years ago, Zamira began her own business with the aim of earning a living. She sells industrious goods in a local market where she has a selling place. Zamira mainly sells buckets, mops, kettles, etc. She manages the business alone. Her working day usually begins in the early morning and she hopes that her business will increase because she works hard. Zamira’s husband is a builder. They are trying to improve their living conditions. Zamira is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy industrious goods for increasing her inventory. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy industrious goods to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 31 years old and married with two children.
Catherine works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines.  She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.
Catherine has been in business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.
Catherine aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with seven children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a buy and sell gasoline business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gasoline to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emelia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Emelia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a shell craft business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Susana is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional shells, glue, paints, etc. for her shell craft business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional shells, glue, paints, etc.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she also earns income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy more vegetables to sell, at her vegetable stall.

Adelfa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell, at her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 49 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Antonieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonieta has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Adamu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food and farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos, age 35, earns the bulk of his income from fattening cattle. He also practices farming to earn an additional income. He has three children and lives in Kamwenge. He started his businesses for the purpose of supporting his children and meeting his personal goals.

Amos hopes to expand his businesses as well as to construct a permanent house. Currently, however, his primary challenge is the lack of capital to meet increasing demand and to deal with the prolonged drought in the region.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Boss

texts.en:
Boss is a twenty-eight-year-old, hardworking, married man. He has four children, and he lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop, which he started so as to improve his standard of living and pay school fees for his children. He earns additional income from an agriculture business. He hopes to have a wholesale shop. His main challenge is competition.

He is requesting a loan to buy more items for his retail business, like soap, salt, and many others.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell at his store, like soap, salt, and many others

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 41 years old and married with three children.
Judy works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, coffee, juice, canned goods, cooking oil, etc. to sell.
Judy has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns an additional income from farming vegetables.
Judy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, coffee, juice, canned goods, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking married lady who deals in farming, mainly cassava. She also earns additional income from goat rearing and fishing nets. She hopes to diversify her business into poultry keeping. However, inadequate capital is still a challenge to her. She will use the loan to buy more land for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy more land for cultivation.

loans.name: Eliana Patricia

texts.es:
Eliana es una mujer emprendedora de 28 años de edad, es soltera y con muchas ganas y empuje.

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su familia, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección, para lo cual ya posee una maquina de confección en su casa; por ello se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una maquina fileteadora, recubridora e insumos de confección como tela e hilos. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado y, con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo.
texts.en:
Eliana is an enterprising 28 year old.  She is single and has a drive to get ahead.  During her working life, she has worked at different sewing workshops as a machine operator, so she has experience and knowledge of these types of businesses.  However, she is tired of working in other businesses and she wants to spend more time with her family, so she decided to open her own sewing workshop.  

She already has a sewing machine in her home, but she is requesting a loan to purchase an overlock machine, an interlock machine, and sewing supplies like fabric and thread.  This will allow her to start her productive project that she hopes will have a good impact in her area so that she can generate good profits.  She wants to achieve her dream of positioning herself in the market and with her drive and ambition, she hopes that in the not too distant future, she can generate employment for others.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine, interlock machine, and sewing supplies like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for equipment such as a blow dryer, chairs, and curling irons as well as the first month's rent

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est mariée et a en sa charge ses trois (03) enfants ; elle est âgée de 34 ans et vit à Baguida avec sa famille. Elle achète du pain-chaud qu’elle revend dans les voisinages avec de la mayonnaise et du pâté depuis 1999, elle s’approvisionne quatre fois dans le mois. Akouvi est bien appréciée et bien aimée dans sa localité compte-tenu de sa bravoure et de son zèle à lutter pour ne pas rester les bras croisés. Elle est en location, se nourrit deux fois par jours, elle n’a pas fréquenté mais maîtrise le planning familial et n’a aucun moyen de déplacement. Akouvi sollicite un appui financier afin de mieux épargner, s’inscrire dans une école d’alphabétisation dispensée les soirées, et aussi pour prendre soins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi is married and has three dependent children. She is 34 years old and lives with her family in Baguida. Since 1999, she buys fresh bread, which she then resells with mayonnaise and pâté in the local area. She buys her supplies four times per month.
Akouvi is appreciated and well-liked in the local community, in part because of her get-up-and-go attitude and her determination not to sit around idle.
She lives in rented accommodation and eats twice a day. She did not attend school, but understands family planning; she has no means of transportation.
Akouvi is seeking financial assistance in order to save more effectively, to enrol in evening literacy classes, and also to take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 140 bread rolls and 2 jars of mayonnaise.

loans.name: Akossiwa Elom

texts.fr: Elom âgée de 46 ans est neé à Assahoun, ville située à 80 kilomètre de la capitale togolaise. Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, Elom est couturière et habite le quartier Bè. Elom a commencé son activité depuis 1994 et s’approvisionne 1 fois par mois au marché d’Akodessewa . Pour son activité de vente de bouillie, Elom sollicite ce crédit pour l'achat du sucre et d'huile végétale afin de pouvoir bien faire la bouillie à ses clients. Ce revenu lui permet de subvenir au besoin de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Elom was born in Assahoun, a town about 80 kilometres from the capital of Togo. She is 46 and married with two children. Elom is a seamstress and lives in the Be district. She started her business in 1994 and buys her stock once a month at the market in Akodessewa. For her business selling gruel, Elom requests this loan to purchase sugar and vegetable oil in order to prepare a good gruel for her customers. This income will enable her to pay for her children's school needs.

loans.use: to buy one sack of sugar and one can of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 30 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with 2 children. He sells milk and has been in this business for 12 years now. The business has been profitable. 

Andrew plans to use this loan to buy more stock of milk from dairy farmers and then supply it to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a land for farming and also to repay the loan. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and, in future, he hopes to grow his business, be successful and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah. He lives with his wife and five kids, three sons and two daughters, in a small, humble house. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Mohammad is also a student in a local university, where he studies business administration. He would like to take a BA degree and find a better job and improve the family’s living conditions. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Milagros De Rubit

texts.es:
Milagros de Rubit tienw 25 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera y sin carga familiar, vive en casa familiar en el PJ. Santa Rosa del distrito de Morropón, el cual es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Milagros de Rubit es el serivicio de peluqueria, peinados, tintes de cabello, siendo conocida en la zona por sus buenas referencias de sus servicios. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compras de tintes para cabello y accesorios para su peluqueria (placha de cabello, rizador, esmalte, entre otros). La inversión le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Milagros de Rubit is 25 years old, single, has no dependents, and lives in her family home in the community of Santa Rosa, Morropon district, a place where the inhabitants practice agriculture, cattle-raising, and commerce. She has basic services like water and lights. The district is located in Morropon province, Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.

Milagros de Rubit's economic activity is to provide hair care services, permanents and hair coloring. She is known in the zone for her good references due to her good services.

Her loan will be used to invest in purchasing hair dyes and accessories for her beauty shop (hair straightener, curling iron, and nail polish, among other items). The investment will help her obtain better income. And that will permit her in a short time, to augment her earnings, and, finally, her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair dyes and accessories for her beauty shop (hair straightener, curling iron, and nail polish, among other items).

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Denia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Denia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as vegetables, fish, meat, etc. for her restaurant business.

Denia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as vegetables, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Crislyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

Crislyn requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more spare parts, tools, and other equipment for her business. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Crislyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts, tools, and other equipment for her business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 65 years old and married with four children.

Estelita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

Estelita has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a hardworking entrepreneur, who buys and sells frozen food products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more frozen products stock to sell.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods stock to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business weaving native products in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as bamboo and ratan (native names for vines used for her business).

Carmen has been in this business for 24 years now.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as bamboo and ratan (native names for vines used for her business).

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 40 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Bernadita has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Bernadita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ditchie

texts.en:
Ditchie is 37 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ditchie is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ditchie has been in the pig fattening business for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 42 years old and has two children. Her children are in school.

Leonarda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Leonarda has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer from the Bamiyayi village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ibrahim said: “I would  be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses like child school fees and food and farm loan repayments.

loans.name: Ihambiro Tukore Group

texts.en:
The lady on the right hand of the photo is called Betty and she is married with 5 children who all go to school. This lady sells second hand clothes, which is her source of income. She decided to apply for a loan of 600,000 shillings in order to add more stock in the business. She aims at buying more dresses to meet the market demands.

Betty details that her income will increase, her children will go to school and also earn a living after adding more capital. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the financial support offered to her and the colleagues in the group. The group took a combined amount of UGX 3,000,000. These group members thank Ugafode for financial assistance, which will help to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to buy dresses to sell.

loans.name: Victoria Elena

texts.es:
Victorina ha sido ama de casa desde que se casó, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia pero, vive en unión libre con su esposo y con sus 2 hijos; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía por catálogo pues era responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar con su esposo y necesitaba generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, accesorios, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Victorina manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales, para que tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Victorina has been a housewife since she married. She is always looking after her family and she lives in a common-law marriage with her husband and two children. She has always wanted to work as an entrepreneur. She began to sell merchandise from catalogs because she was responsible for supporting her family financially with her husband and needed to generate the money to do so. 

Her customers are neighbors, family members, and friends in the area. She works alone every day and she finds it advantageous that her work lets her look after her family. At the same time, she has been very productive as a vendor.

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, accessories, and other things in bulk. This will allow her to stock up with a variety of things to satisfy the demand that increases during the holiday season. As a result of earning greater income for her family, Victorina's greatest wish is to keep supporting her family financially and give education to all of her children. This way they can become professionals and have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, accessories, and other things in bulk.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a maize farmer from Kuradawa village. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Naomi would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Naomi can now store her maize at harvest time. She can sell it a few months later, for a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. When asked, Naomi said: “I would now be able to use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food, and/or farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Working in the field is one of the most difficult jobs nowadays because of the great effort needed to make progress. However, James is a man who has never given up in spite of any circumstances that occur. He is always ready to get resources for his family. He gets up at the first hour in the morning in order to tend to his business of raising and selling poultry and vegetables, as well as some personal business he engages in to supplement the meager income he earns. 

James is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. He realized that he is working increasingly longer and harder on his farm. The workmen in the area are currently doing tasks on the farm previously performed by women. They have been forced to take over as their wives are left at home doing household chores. Therefore, the tools men use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields, and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well in using poor traditional tools. The increased income from the use of better tools will help him meet business related expenses. 

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" James replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To purchase modern farming implements

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer from Bawa Rumi Village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Lawal said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing income by up to 37%

loans.name: Fotimajon

texts.en:
Fotimajon is a 45-year old widow who lives with her three sons in B. Gafurov district of Khujand city. The two older sons work as taxi drivers, and the youngest son helps his mother in the business. 

Fotimajon is an experienced entrepreneur. She has conducted her trading business for twenty years. She has a shop where she sells a various assortment of carpets. Fotimajon offers customers high-quality and beautiful carpets. Therefore, there is always demand for her goods. 

Currently Fotimajon wants to expand her activities. She is asking for a loan to purchase a car. She will use the car in her business for transportation of goods. This will facilitate her work. 

Fotimajon relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a car for transportation of carpets.

loans.name: Umoja Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her late 30s, is a divorcee with two children who are still in school. She has been running a grocery store for three years now. She works from 10am to 11pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Asha's 17th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep buying the out of stock items in the grocery, to buy chairs and tables and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing fine with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a TV set, a radio, a deck, a cupboard for storing chips and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy new round tables, new chairs, spirits and the out of stock drinks in the grocery store. She dreams of building her own house.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Umoja Kigogo", which consist of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new round tables, new chairs, spirits and the out of stock drinks in the grocery store.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is married and has three children. She sells fruits, which she has been doing fo more than 15 years. Gulnora buys fruits in bulk and sells in a local market. She sells a variety of fruits, such as apples and bananas. She is very sociable woman and makes an individual approach to each customer. Her husband helps her with managing the business. 

Gulnora requested a loan for 2,500 Somoni, which she will use to buy fruits. The loan will help her increase working capital and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 30 years, married, and has three children. Her husband runs his own business, providing additional income for his family. Monica operates a general store, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns a monthly income of  35,000 KES.

Monica requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya for 30,000 KES, which she will use to add stock of retail goods, such as baking flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, and margarine, to sell in her shop. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to provide for her family's basic needs as well as repay her loan. She hopes to become successful in her business as it becomes stable and improved.

loans.use: to purchase stock of retail goods, such as baking flour, maize flour, sugar, rice, and margarine, to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase surplus timber for making different attractive wood products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
The borrower's name is Cecilia. She is aged 46 and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a carpenter, and has three children. She manages her household while operating a business. She works hard, to augment their income in order to meet their daily household needs and to send her children to school.

Cecilia has been operating a variety store for five years, already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities, directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go, to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1000 a day.

To help her grow and continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy grocery items, such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda, and other groceries. She is positive that it will boost her income, as she expands her business. Her earnings are the family's income source for meeting their daily living expenses and sending her children to school. She is thanking God and you, in advance, for the financial help that will be given her.

Cecilia hopes to maintain and grow her business, so they could have a better and comfortable life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible, and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Letecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is 57 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 18,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Elvis has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elvis would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Mercenita works hard to support her family.
She has a sells dried fish in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming vegetables. Mercenita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish.  Mercenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in able to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marlina works hard to support her family.
She deals in portable stoves in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming vegetables and a general store. Marlina is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more portable stoves to sell. Marlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more portable stove to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ma. Patricia

texts.en:
Ma. Patricia is 30 years old and married with two children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Patricia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Ma. Patricia has been raising pigs for 2 years and earns additional income from farming vegetables.
She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 27 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Marivic has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi est âgée de 35 ans, mariée elle est mère de quatre enfants. Elle vit dans un des quartier de Bè appelé Anfamé. Amivi est restauratrice et elle prépare et vend  des   boules de maïs préparé communément appelé « COM » en éwé il y a 24 ans. Avec ce crédit elle pense acheter un sac de maïs, un demi-carton de poisons frais et les condiments pour la commercialisation. Avec les revenu de ce commerce elle peut contribuer aux charges de la famille et à l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Amivi is 35 years old, she is married and the mother of four children. She lives in the Anfamé district of Bè. Amivi has operated a catering business for 24 years, and she cooks and sells corn balls, commonly known as "Com" in the Ewé local language.
With this loan she intends to buy a bag of corn, half a crate of fresh fish and some condiments in order to be able to sell the balls.
With the income from this business, she can contribute to the family's expenses and also to the children's education.

loans.use: to buy one bag of corn and a half crate of fresh fish.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: De nationalité togolaise, Amélé, demeurant à Lomé au quartier Baguida est âgée de 32 ans ; elle est mariée et mère d’un seul enfant ; elle vend des pagnes depuis 2011 dans sa petite boutique. Au fait, Amélé achète ses pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et s’approvisionne quatre (04) fois par mois. Elle est logé gratuitement dans un bâtiment construite en dur, et dont le toit est en tuile, se nourrit deux fois jours.                                                                                                                    Amélé souhaiterait un appui financier pour plus soutenir son commerce afin de mieux vendre, faire des bénéfices et mieux épargner pour faire face aux diverses charges de son foyers.
texts.en: Amele is Togolese and lives in the Baguida district of Lome. She is 32 and married with one child. She has been selling traditional wear since 2011 in her little shop. In fact, Amele buys her fabrics at the big market in Lome and stocks up four times every month. She lives gratuitously in a building that is made with cement with tiles on the roof and eats twice a day. Amele requests financial aid to give her more support for her business to enable her to sell more, make more profit, and save up more to cope with the various expenses of her household.

loans.use: to buy four units of traditional dress fabric.

loans.name: Norelia

texts.es:
Norelia es una mujer muy dinámica y emprendedora, madre de 1 hijo por el que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido tener un negocio de venta de todo tipo de mercancía como ropa, cosméticos y accesorios.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar surtido de este tipo de mercancía. 

Con este nuevo negocio y con la ayuda de un préstamo podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y su hijo.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Norelia is a very dynamic and enterprising woman. She is the mother to one son, for whom she has had to go through many adversities in life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family. 

For a while, she has wanted to have a business selling all kinds of merchandise, such as cosmetics and accessories. This is why she is requesting a huge economic breath of encouragement to purchase a wide selection of this kind of products. With this new business and with the help of a loan, she will be able to earn income for her family, which is everything to her, and she will be able to improve the quality of life for her husband and her son.

She will work hard every day to drive her business forward and make it a sustainable and affordable activity. Support a hard-working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Bello, habitan muchas personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras con las ganas y fuerzas para salir adelante y luchar por un buen futuro; uno de ellas es Rosa, una madre que con su carisma y gran capacidad de trabajo ha podido superar varios obstáculos que se le han presentado en su vida.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanías en su propia casa, oficio que inicio como alternativa para obtener ingresos y poco a poco se convirtió en una fuente de ingreso real para el sostenimiento de sus 6 hijos

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela e hilos para la elaboración de bolsos artesanales.

Con estos elementos podrá sacar adelante su negocio y sus productos, que son vendidos principalmente en almacenes, ferias, y algunos habitantes del municipio.
texts.en:
Many enterprising and hard-working people with the drive and strength to get ahead and to fight for a better future live in the municipality of Bello. One of these people is Rosa, a woman who, with her charisma and hard work, has been able to surpass several obstacles that life has presented her with.

She has a small business creating and selling handicrafts in her house. She began this job as an alternative to earn income, and slowly it has become a real source of income to support her 6 children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fabric and thread to make hand-crafted bags. With these products, she will be able to get her business and her products ahead. Her products are mostly sold in stores, markets and to some neighbors in the municipality.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread to make hand-crafted bags.

loans.name: Pole

texts.en: Pole lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 23 years old and married with two children. He operates a retail shop mainly selling soap, plastics, rice, and sugar among other items. He hopes to expand his business so as to improve his standard of living. He will use the loan to buy more sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal, age 25 and unmarried, earns a low wage as an employee in a local firm in the city of Rafah, where he lives with his family in a small house. His low earnings provide the sole income for his family. 

Bilal is also a student at a local university, where he is studying elementary education. His goal is to earn his BA degree, obtain a good teaching job, and improve his family's living conditions.
 
He requested a loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for his university studies. Through this loan, Bilal will be better able to accomplish homework assignments and write reports.
