Shahid, 35 years old, has been running a school for the past two years. He worked as a teacher for seven years before deciding to start his own school. Shahid's goals are to eliminate illiteracy in the generation of children in his community and to give his 170 students the best education he can. 

In order to construction a classroom and washroom for his school, he has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR. Shahid's wife supports his dream and helps with the management of the school. He believes that hard work is the key to success and he works hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to construct a classroom and washroom for his school.

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en: Madiha has been running a school. Over 150 students study in her school, of which more than half are girls. She has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 to provide furniture for classrooms, and purchase computers for a computer lab in her school. Her goal is to provide the students in her school with the highest quality education that she can. Madiha is motivated and is determined to work hard to improve her school both in terms of quality and the revenue she generates to contribute towards her household.

loans.use: to provide furniture for classrooms, and purchase computers for a computer lab in her school.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en: Humaira, age 34, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, rears them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la agricultura se dedica al cultivo de sandia y elotes, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, vive en casa propia con su madre, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He has devoted himself to agriculture for six years.  He grows watermelon and corn.  He sells his products in the areas around where he lives.  He lives in his own house with his mother.

This young man is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc.  He will also improve the land shown in the photo in order to be able to continue with his work and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Marco Alberto

texts.es: Marco de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el trabaja en una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, Marco quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos para sus hijos, pero con lo que le pagan no le alcanza  para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito y poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro, laminas, pago de mano de obra, etc. y asi poder tener junto con su familia una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Marco, 35, lives in his own house with his life partner and his two children.  He works for a private company and is able to get ahead with what he earns in his job.

Marco wants to improve his home and build some bedrooms for his children, but he doesn't earn enough money to pay for it.  He's requesting a loan so he can buy the materials he needs (bricks, cement, sand, rebar, metal roofing), pay for labor, and so forth.  That way he and his family will have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, rebar, and metal roofing, and to pay for labor, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, friperies, parures et chaussures. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïchata (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une vendeuse de friperies de toutes sortes (soutien-gorge, sous-vêtements, serviettes, culottes, pantalons, chemises, etc). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 balles  de friperies  en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails au marché de Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aïchata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in monogamous households, the five members of the group Benkadi average 33 years of age and three children each. The women live in Sabalibougou, a district of Bamako, and they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses in Sabalibougou. The group members work in small-scale commerce involving secondhand clothing, fine accessories, and shoes. 

With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Aïchata (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) is a vendor of used clothing of all types (bras, undergarments, serviettes, shorts, pants, shirts, etc.) She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 bales of secondhand clothing wholesale in Médine. Her sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed mostly of women at the Sabalibougou market and by going door to door. 

With this loan, Ms. Aïchata plans on making an average monthly profit 100,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and to meet sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es: Jose de 52 años de edad se dedica desde hace 12 años a la agricultura al cultivo de tomates, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, insecticidas etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 52 years old, has worked for 12 years in agriculture, growing tomatoes. He sells his products in the various markets that are located near his house. He lives with his life companion and their two children in their own house. 

Jose is applying for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, compost, pest controls, insecticides, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph in order to continue with his work and have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, insecticides, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items and inputs for her catering service.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Veuve de 45ans, Virginie a en charge 3 enfants âgées de 13,15 et 17ans tous scolarisés. Pour mieux prendre soins de ces derniers, elle a décidé de vendre depuis 1990 des pagnes et produits alimentaires. Activité qu'elle mène à domicile et de façon ambulante. A l’approche des périodes de fêtes, elle souhaite acheter en quantité considérable pour servir les demandes c'est pour cela, Virginie demande un premier crédit. Le profit lui servira d'agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: A 45-year-old widow, Virginie supports three children, 13, 15, and 17 years old, all in school. To care for them better, Virginie decided in 1990 to sell ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and grocery items. This is a business she operates at home and by going door to door. As the holiday season approaches, she would like to purchase goods in considerable quantities to meet the demand. So Virginie is asking for an initial loan. The profit will be used to expand her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ‘pagne’ cloth and grocery items

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 26 years old. He is married to Jackline and together they have been blessed with one child who is 1 year old. Jackline is a tailor, and provides additional income for her family.

Samson is a carpenter, a business he has done for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

Samson has requested his third loan with VisionFund Kenya of 30,000 KES, which he will use to purchase mahogany wood for making wall units and coffee table sets to sell.

With the anticipated profits. Samson will be able to provide for his family's basic needs as well as repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to become successful in his business and to thrive in order to become a wholesale supplier of quality furniture in his area.

loans.use: to purchase mahogany wood for making wall units and coffee table sets.

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.es:
Jose es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, siempre preocupado por el bienestar de sus seres queridos, actualmente trabaja como operario de construcción en su ciudad natal, San Martin. También con mucho esfuerzo ha comprado unos terrenos y está cultivando cacao, espera más adelante poder convertirse en un gran empresario y productor de cacao.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, por ellos siempre lucha para poder sacarlos adelante.
En esta oportunidad Jose quiere utilizar el crédito para poder comprar insumos para abonar sus plantas y realizar el mantenimiento de sus tierras. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, porque con esto espera poder ofrecer productos de mejor calidad y con los ingresos obtenidos mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a very loving and responsible father.  He is always concerned about the well-being of his loved ones.  He currently works as a construction operator in his native city of San Martin.  Also, with great effort he has purchased some land and is growing cacao.  He hopes to later on be able to become a great businessman and cacao producer. His greatest motivation in life is his family.  He always struggles in order to be able to get them ahead.

At this time Jose wants to use the loan to be able to buy supplies to fertilize his plants and to perform maintenance on his land.  He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity.  With this he hopes to be able to offer better quality products.  With the income he gets he hopes to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic supplies for his cacao plants.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina is 33 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, coffee, noodles, diapers, seasonings, and cereals to sell.

Sabrina has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs.

Sabrina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, coffee, noodles, diapers, seasonings, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda, age 47, farms sugarcane to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for the past three years, and she earns an additional income from raising pigs.

She and her husband have three children.

Florenda requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Lilibeth requested her fourth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josue Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur OUSMANE FRANCOIS est le représentant du groupe JOSUE.   Marié, il est  père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06 ans, le moins âgé a 1 an 10mois. Personne ne  va à l’école.
Monsieur fait agriculture et l’élevage depuis plus de 27ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son village.
 Il veut s’acheter de 03 d’engrais, 03boites de semences  d’oignon, 04moutons et 10poules.
Monsieur  veut utiliser ses  bénéfices pour construire une maison d’habitation et préparer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur et avoir des bœufs.
texts.en:
Mr. OUSMANE FRANCOIS is the representative of the group JOSUE. A married father, he has two children. The oldest is 6 years old, and the youngest is 10 months old. None goes to school. 

Mr. OUSMANE FRANCOIS has been a farmer and raising livestock for over 27 years. He gets his supplies from his village. He wants to purchase 3 [sacks] of fertilizer, 3 cans of onion seeds, 4 sheep, and 10 hens. He wants to use his profits to build a house and to prepare his children for school. His ambition is to become a major livestock farmer and to own steers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, sheep, and hens

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Most Kenyans struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Francis, 69, who is based in the Nkubu area of Kenya and is the father of eight lovely children. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past twenty years. He has managed to earn a decent income. His primary sources of income are crop farming, dairy farming and personal business, and through these ventures he has been able to make ends meet. 

Francis and his family live in the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has good weather patterns that support farming activities. Francis is very enterprising, and through farming he has been able to support his family, although he has been facing challenges. That is why he is seeking a loan to buy farm implements that will assist him to produce more. 

With the loan, Francis will be able to completely turn around his life because the production level on his farm will increase, and this means more income. Through the loan, he will be able to assure his family of improved living standards, and he is confident that the new profits will allow him to comfortably repay the loan. Francis intends to purchase more land through savings that he will make, and this will assure his family of a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria es una madre de dos pequeños hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad y por los cuales ha luchado incansablemente para sostenerlos y brindarles todo lo que necesitan.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como artículos para el aseo personal, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de sus hijos.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos como cremas de manos, desodorantes, lociones, enjugues, entre otros, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a mother of two children aged 8 and 10 years of age. She has fought tirelessly to support them and provide everything they need. 

She is a vendor of merchandise such as items for personal hygiene. It’s a good way to generate good income while being around her children.

Today, she is starting with a very small amount of capital and is collecting payments for her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a range of products such as hand creams, deodorants, lotions, body washes, and other products wholesale so that she can stock her small business with quality products.

With the help of her loan she can boost her business and have a better range or products to offer, leading to the strengthening of her business.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and piglets to fatten and sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David and his wife Gjiste operate a vineyard, where they grow grapes to earn their living. They earn an additional income by raising livestock, including poultry and rabbits.

They are presently seeking your financial assistance in order to perform some work on their vineyard. With their loan funds in the amount of 100,000 Albanian lek, they intend to build additional pillars in order to expand their vines.

loans.use: to expand his vineyard

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina de 42 años de edad, solo estudio tercer grado. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería un trabajo muy bueno para darle la alimentación a su familia de los hijos que han procreado solo cuatro viven con ellos, ya que los otros ya tienen su familia a parte.
Reina se dedica al negocio de pan desde hace 8 años, aprendió el oficio con su madre ya que ella tenía. Reina es una mujer muy conocida en cuanto a la calidad de pan que elabora, el horno lo tiene en la  casa de la mamá, el pan lo elabora en horas de la mañana para salir a vender durante el día. El negocio solo una hija se involucra con ella.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar harina, levadura, huevos, azúcar, manteca, para el pan y una parte para la agricultura.
Su sueño es que el negocio crezca más porque a medida pasa el tiempo tiene más demanda de clientes y con las ganancias las invertiré en el mejoramiento de su vivienda para que su familia viva en una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reina is 42 years old. She only went to school through third grade. Her husband works as a mason, a job that is very good for feeding his family. Of their children, only four live with them, since the others already have their own families.

Reina has worked in the bread business for eight years. She learned this trade from her mother, since she had [the same business]. Reina is a well-known woman because of the quality of the bread that she makes. She has the oven in her mother's house. She makes the bread during the morning hours in order to go out to sell during the day. Only one daughter is involved in the business with her.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy flour, leavening, eggs, sugar, and lard for the bread, and a part is for agriculture.

Her dream is that her business will grow more, because as time passes she has more demand from customers, and with the earnings she will invest in the improvement of her house so that her family can live with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, leavening, eggs, sugar, and lard for bread and to use a part for agriculture

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products. They earn enough to meet the expenses of their children. 

Samina requested a loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and beverages

loans.name: Meeran

texts.en: Meeran, age 41, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). They buy animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, rear them and then sell them out in the market at higher prices. They earn a good amount of income to support their household expenditures. In order to expand their business, Meeran applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as baby goats and calves. It will help her improve her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as baby goats and calves for improving her sales and profits.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kousar, age 43, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store for a period of about five years. She offers a variety of beauty products and hair accessories in her store, and she has garnered a strong customer base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Kousar needs to have various goods in stock so that she can efficiently meet customer demand. She has therefore requested a loan in the amount of PKR 30,000, which she will use to buy such items as as lotions, creams, hair clips, and rubber bands. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store, allowing her to bring in better earnings.

loans.use: to buy such items as as lotions, creams, hair clips, and rubber bands to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Shahmeem

texts.en:
Shahmeem, is 52-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

She makes sufficient amounts of income to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, biscuits, grains, milk, and juices for the market at lower rates. 

In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Shahmeem wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, biscuits, grains, milk, and juices at lower rates.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 51 years old and operates a shop, which she has been doing for seven years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Shamim needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

Shamim requested a loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy additional items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Umoja Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Edith, a member of Umoja Women group. She is forty-five years old, married and blessed with six children whom she lives with.

Edith is a farmer who grows maize and beans. She has undergone Hand in Hand training modules on savings mobilization, enterprise and financial management. This has helped her acquire entrepreneurial skills. Due to the high demand for farming produce she is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes this will help increase the crop yield. She hopes this will lead to increased income. This will enable her to ensure food security in her household.

Edith is very grateful to Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pestcides.

loans.name: Amenoudji Gisèle

texts.fr: Gisèle vit à Lomé dans le quartier Tokoin ; âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et a  4 enfants. Elle est commerçante d’oignon de 2005 à 2007 ; de 2007 à 2008 de fruits, de 2008 à 2014 de boule d’Akassan. Elle  vend de manière ambulante dans les quartiers d’Anfamé  et  d’Adakpamé. Elle  vit dans  sa propre maison ; elle se nourrit deux fois par jour et a un niveau d’étude primaire ; elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au marché d’Akodessewa.  Elle désire avoir un soutien financier pour accroître son activité génératrice de revenu pour aider son foyer à mieux s’en sortir dans les dépenses quotidiennes et maximiser de profits. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour acheter 13 sacs maïs et 5 litre d'huile végétale.
texts.en:
Gisèle lives in Lomé, in the Tokoin neighborhood; she is 39 years old and married with four children. She sold onions from 2005 to 2007, fruit from 2007 to 2008, and has been selling boules d'Akassan [steamed balls of corn porridge] since 2008. She sells door-to-door in the Anfamé and Adakpamé neighborhoods.

Gisèle lives in her own house. She eats twice a day and went to elementary school. She gets her supplies once a week from the Akodessewa market.

Gisèle wants to have financial support in order to grow her business to help her household better handle the day-to-day expenses and maximize profits. She is thus seeking this loan to purchase 13 sacks of corn and five liters of vegetable oil.

loans.use: To purchase 13 sacks of corn and five liters of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Hafizu

texts.en:
Hafizu is a maize farmer from Kankanki village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hafizu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hafizu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hafizu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Manuel Adan

texts.es: Manuel tiene  49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 10 años, 8 años y 6 años de edad. Manuel es un hombre muy trabajador quien con mucho esfuerzo se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en su tienda y además, vende pescado en las diferentes zonas cercanas a su localidad. Con el deseo de mantener su negocio por mucho más tiempo solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio de tienda para el cual necesita comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería como: azúcar, leche, pan dulce, frijoles, sal, aceite, golosinas, etc.
texts.en: Manuel is 49 years old and lives in his own house along with his life companion and their three children, ages 10, 8, and 6. Manuel is a very hard-working man who with great effort earns a living and brings sustenance to his household. For a long time he has earned a living selling products of basic necessity in his store, and in addition, he sells fish in the various zones near his location. With the desire to maintain his business for a much longer time, he is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in his grocery store business, for which he needs to buy a greater quantity of merchandise such as sugar, milk, sweet breads, beans, salt, oil, candies, etc.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, sweet breads, beans, salt, oil, candies, etc., for his store

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 20-year-old single man from Rafah. He lives with his family in a small, humble house. He works as an employee in a coffee shop in the city where he earns a low income. 

Abdel is also a student at a local university where he studies Elementary Education. He would like to earn a BA degree and find a better job to improve the family's living conditions.

Abdel took a loan from FATEN to help him buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to more easily do his homework and write the reports.

Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Âgée de 59ans, Améyo veuve avec en charge 04 enfants en age majeur revend des poissons fumés au marché. Elle vend des poissons fumés qu'elle fait elle même et se fait aidée par 01 personne. Son troisième crédit lui servira d'acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Améyo, aged 59, is a widow with four adult children to support. She sells smoked fish at the market. She smokes the fish herself and is helped by one person. Her third loan will be used to purchase more merchandise. She hopes to expand her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 26 years old and married, and together with her spouse she has been blessed with three children. She sells tea and tea leaves and she has been in this business for 2 years.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of green tea and tea leaves to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves and tea to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 45 years old and married and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children. She runs a hotel (synonymous with restaurant in Kenya) and has been in this business for 10 years. Right now her monthly income is 15,000 KES. 

Emily will be using this loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour for use in her hotel. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of cereals for use in her hotel.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and get more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy does poultry farming and has been in the business for 5 years. She is 31 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 2 children.

She plans to use this loan to expand the poultry house so she can rear more chicken. She will buy timber, wire mesh and iron sheets. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her poultry farming business and succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy material for building a bigger poultry house.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling organic and herbal products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers for her business.

Flora has been in this business for 13 years. Flora earns more income from raising pigs, electronic mobile load retailing, and a general store.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Melanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melanie has been raising pigs for three years and also earns income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a food vendor, preparing and selling food to earn her living. She earns an additional income from farming rice and corn. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. Claudine and her husband have two children, and she works hard to support her family.
 
Claudine requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to sufficiently build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José  de 36 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 9 grado. Su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y también vende productos de belleza por catálogo, tienen 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando y viven con ellos en casa.
José es motorista  hace viajes hasta honduras a traer mercadería como verdura para venderla en el mercado, se dedica al oficio desde hace 12 años; el trabajo lo aprendió con su padre que era motorista. Ahora él está agradecido con el papá porque le dejo buena enseñanza de como poder ganar el dinero honestamente. El horario de trabajo es de 4 de la mañana a 7de la noche y muchas veces varia el horario.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar hierro, arena, bloque,  cemento.  Para reparar su vivienda, para tener una mayor seguridad en su casa y su familia vivirá en una mejor calidad de vida.
Su sueño es ayudarle en  lo que pueda  a su familia y hasta donde Dios  le de fuerzas para trabajar.
texts.en: Jose is 36 years old. He only attended school up to 9th grade. His partner works in household chores, and she also sells beauty products by catalog. They have 3 children, who attend school and live with them at home. Jose works as a driver. He makes trips to Honduras to bring merchandise such as vegetables in order to sell them at the market. He has worked in this job for 12 years. He learned this job with his father, who was a driver. Now, he is grateful to his dad, because he taught him how to earn money honestly. His work schedule is from 4 in the morning to 7 in the evening. Many times his schedule varies. He is requesting a loan to buy iron, sand, building blocks, cement, to repair his house and make it more safe. His family will have a better quality of life. His dream is to help his family as much possible and until God gives him strength to work.

loans.use: to buy iron, sand, building blocks, cement.

loans.name: Olmahon

texts.ru: Олмахон 48 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. В 1988 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота. Олмахон на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 6 овец. На участке мерою 1,30 Га она выращивает арбузы и хлопок. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). Олмахон является лидером группы "Кызыл - Туу", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Всего их трое. Олмахон обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Олмахон развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Olmahon is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four. In 1988 she launched a livestock business. At present Olmahon owns two cows and six sheep. She also has a land plot of 1.3 ha [3.2.acres], where she grows watermelons and cotton. Her total monthly revenue is 25,000 KGS on the average. Olmahon is the leader of the Kyzyl-Tuu group. In addition to Olmahon, there are two other members in this group; thus there are three members altogether. Olmahon has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep. The resulting revenue will allow Olmahon to develop her business and improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cicelia

texts.en:
Cicelia, age 58, runs a general store to earn her living. She has operated her business for eight years, and she also earns additional income from food vending and raising cattle.

She and her husband have five children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

Cicelia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a new loan in the amount of PhP 15,000. She will use her loan funds to buy a stock of goods to offer for sale in her general store.

Her goal is to save enough money to enable her to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a stock of goods to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (pastries, dairy products, cookies, and grains, among others).

loans.name: Makou

texts.fr: Makou est  âgée de 45 ans. Mariée, elle vit  à Lomé, dans leur propre maison,  dans le quartier d’Attiégou avec  un enfant. Elle se  nourrit trois fois ou plus  par jour et a un niveau d’étude primaire. Elle est commerçante de trousseau bébé et d’habits d’enfants de 2000 à 2008 ; de pagne de 2008 à 2013 et de friperie. Son premier crédit lui a permis de diversifier son activité en associant la vente de fournitures scolaires. Elle vend  au marché d’Akodessewa Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé deux (02) fois par mois. Elle désire avoir un soutien financier pour accroître son activité génératrice de revenu pour aider son foyer à mieux s’en sortir dans les dépenses quotidiennes et maximiser de profits.
texts.en:
Makou is 45 years old and is married. She lives in Lomé in her own home, in the Attiégou neighborhood, with one child. She eats three times per day and attended elementary school. She sold baby supplies and children's clothing from 2000 to 2008, and pagnes [traditional cloth] and secondhand clothing from 2008 to 2013. Her first loan allowed her to diversify her business by including the sale of school supplies.

Makou sells at the Akodessewa market. She gets her supplies at Lomé's Grand Market twice per month. She wants to have financial support in order to grow her business to help her household better handle the day-to-day expenses and maximize profits.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a clothes sewing business at her home, as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Razia is popularly known in her area for her fine stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting the daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She is in her fourth loan cycle. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase supplies such as spools of thread, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time. 

Razia hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as spools of thread, laces, zippers, and cloth

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine est née à Vogan, ville située au sud-est de Lomé est âgée de 57 ans. Mariée, elle  est mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit  à Lomé, dans le quartier Bè. Elle est en location avec ses enfants.Elle est analphabète. Depuis 1992 jusqu’à ce jour, elle fait le commerce de vente de maïs et de farine de manioc (gari). Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son village et de Tsévié chaque deux semaines. Elle vend ces marchandises au marché d’Akodessewa.  Elle désire avoir un soutien financier pour acheter 2 sacs de maïs et 90 bols de farine de manioc pour aider son foyer à mieux s’en sortir dans les dépenses quotidiennes et maximiser de profits.
texts.en:
Christine was born in Vogan, a town located southwest of Lomé. She is 57 years old, married, and the mother of four. She lives in Lomé in the Bè district. She rents a place with her children. She is illiterate. Since 1992 until today, she has been doing commerce in corn and cassava flour (gari). She gets her supplies at the market of her village and from Tsévié every two weeks. She sells her merchandise at the Akodessewa market. 

She would like to have financial support to purchase 2 sacks of corn and 90 bowls of cassava flour in order to help out at home, so as to do better at managing day-to-day expenses and maximizing profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn and cassava flour

loans.name: Kisab Women Group

texts.en:
Mercy, raising her hand in the photograph, is a member of the Kisab Women Group. She is twenty-six years old and blessed with four children. She is married and lives with her family. She raises maize, beans and potatoes. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training she received which equipped her with business knowledge and skills. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer to boost her potatoes farming business. This will lead to improved crop yield hence increased income. She intends to use part of the anticipated profit to provide a balanced diet of food to the family and pay school fees for the children.

Mercy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is Margaret, a single mother with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from trainings on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her acquire business management skills.

Her economic activity is dairy farming. She needs a loan to buy higher quality fodder for her cows. This will increase their milk production and help her keep up with increased demand for milk. She hopes this will increase her level of income and put her in a position to continue supporting her family and also educating her children.

Margaret is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy quality fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pliers, screens, glue, tubes, screws, transistor radio circuit boards, etc.

loans.name: Nuska

texts.ru: Нуска, 52 года, замужем, 6 детей, образование средне-специальное. Больше 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Нуска имеет 3 коровы, 3 лошади и 25 овец. Также на 3,0 ГА собственной земли она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Нуска очень предприимчивая и хорошо знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуска обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Она намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на постройку сарая.
texts.en: Nuska is 52, married, and has six children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education with some vocational training, and has grown crops and raised livestock for more than 20 years.  She currently has 3 cows, 3 horses and 25 sheep on her farm, as well as 3.0 hectares of her own land for growing clover for her farm, while her monthly income is roughly 18,000 som.  Nuska is very entrepreneurial and well-acquainted with everything needed to run a farm; to grow her business, she is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy 3 cows.  She is intent on adding more animals to her farm, and plans on saving her extra income due to this loan to build a barn.

loans.use: purchase three cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a food vendor, preparing and selling food to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for six years, and she works hard to help her husband support their family. 
 
Myrna requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy necessary ingredients for preparing and selling food items.

In the future, Myrna would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy necessary ingredients for preparing and selling food items

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Adriana, de 43 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la confección gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fabricas donde trabajaba como operaria de maquinas de confección.

Hoy en día es una mujer independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y una pequeña línea propia.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora y su motivación más grande para trabajar son sus hijos quienes en algunas ocasiones le ayudan en su negocio.

Ella tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de un auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra 
 Algunos insumos de trabajo como tela, agujas, entre otros.

Con este préstamo ella podrá mantener su actividad vigente y seguirá ofreciendo empleo a las personas del sector.
texts.en:
Adriana, 43, has extensive experience in the area of clothing with multiple jobs in different factories where she has worked as a sewing machine operator.

Nowadays, she is an independent woman and earns her own income by making clothing for third parties with her own small clothing line.

She is a very enterprising woman and her biggest motivation to work are her children, who sometimes help her in her business.

She has many projects which she wants to complete as quickly as she can but she needs financial help which will allow her to inject capital into her business through her purchases. She will buy labor inputs such as fabric, needles, and more. 

With this loan, she will maintain her current business and will continue to provide employment for people in the industry.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, needles, and more.

loans.name: Kelly Jhoana

texts.es:
Kelly, de 26 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de calzado en distintos almacenes del municipio de Medellín.

Desea iniciar con un negocio propio de fabricación y venta de zapatos en todos los estilos.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una joven emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de materiales como cuero, suelas, pegantes y telas. Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este negocio y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Kelly, 26, is very clear about what she wants in life and is determined to finish her studies in order to move froward and have a good life.

She works as a saleswoman in different shoe stores in the municipality of Medellin. 

She wants to start her own business making and selling shoes of all styles. She wants to start this activity because she has the desire to generate the resources she needs to support herself and her education, in addition to helping with expenses at home.

She is a young, very disciplined entrepreneur. She is requesting a loan to buy a wide range of materials such as leather, soles, adhesives, and fabrics. With these elements, she can start this business and improve her quality of life. 

She hopes to progress as an entrepreneur and have a more stable income.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Niña Cielo

texts.en:
Niña Cielo is 24 years old and married with one child.

Niña Cielo works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like chocolate drinks, coffee, juice, sugar, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Niña Cielo has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Niña Cielo aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Saud2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Saud2. It consists of four hardworking women from Hodeidah,Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.

Saeda is a very active woman from a poor family. She is 43 years old and a mother of seven children. She is the leader of the group. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time, he became unable to look after of his family. Saeda wanted to help him in this responsibility. She has been selling women's clothes as a door to door business with a small capital for three years. Her income from this business is very low, and she wanted to improve it more but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she asked a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes to resell them to her customers.

Saeda looks forward to expanding her business more through opening a store to sell all kinds of clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Lirika

texts.en: In a previous loan, Lirika felt uncomfortable to be photographed. Well, this time she was ready to have her photograph taken next to her husband Nikolla. Previously, they did some repairs to their house to keep it from collapsing. They want to continue fixing things in their home, since they are not done. They must repair the roofing of their house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To fix the collapsing roofing of her house

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
This is Veronicah, 42 years old, married, and blessed with three children.

She earns a living by doing maize farming and operating a kiosk where she sells cereals and fruit. She is borrowing a loan to add more stocks of pawpaws, bananas, and millet in her business and also to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and planting seeds. This will lead to growth of her businesses. 

She hopes that her income will increase, hence she will be able to achieve her goal of educating her children and also providing for other family needs like food and clothing.

Veronicah is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for pesticides and fertilizer and to purchase additional stocks of bananas, pawpaws, and millet.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary, 61 years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize and beans farming as her main economic activity. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage her farming activities well. 

She is borrowing a loan to boost her farming by buying manure. This will improve the crop yield leading to more supply for the market. She looks forward to an improved income that will assist her in catering for the family's needs and paying school fees for the children. 

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase manure.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a vigorous 44-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Her husband is a well-known tailor in their area. They stitch clothes for the people of their community to support their entire family.

By this time, they have retained a good number of customers. To fulfill the orders on time, Shamim has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will allow them to purchase stock of threads, laces, ribbons, cloth and buttons in different colors. She expects a boost in their earnings and aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

Shamim is in her 5th loan cycle and has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to purchase stock of threads, laces, ribbons, cloth and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est  âgée de 43 ans. Divorcée, elle vit  à Lomé, en location,  dans le quartier Bè. Elle vit avec  son  enfant. Elle se  nourrit deux fois  par jour et a un niveau d’étude secondaire et plus. Elle est commerçante des ustensiles de cuisines (casserole, marmite, cuillère)  depuis 1999 jusqu’à ce jour. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra, deux (02) fois par semaine.  Elle vend au marché de son quartier. Elle désire avoir un soutien financier pour accroître son activité génératrice de revenus pour aider son foyer à mieux s’en sortir dans les dépenses quotidiennes et maximiser de profits.
texts.en: Ayélé, aged 43, is divorced and living in Lomé renting in the Bè district. She lives with her child. She eats twice a day and has at least a secondary education. Ayélé is a merchant who has been selling kitchen utensils (pots, pans, and spoons) since 1999 until today. She gets her supplies from Ghana, in Accra, twice a week. She sells at the market in her district. She would like to have financial support to grow her revenue-generating business in order to help out at home, so as to do better at managing day-to-day expenses and maximize profit.

loans.use: to purchase 2 dozen spoons and 5 boxes of knives

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi est une femme âgée de 64 ans. Elle est veuve et mère  d’un enfant  qui est scolarisé. Elle habite à Adidogomé. 
Essi est revendeuse de condiments  depuis 11 ans  et s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au marche d'Agoè-Assiyeye. Essi à un niveau moyen de scolarisation et sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter 3 sacs de piment et 3 sacs de riz. Les revenus de son activité lui permettront d'améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Essi is a 64-year-old woman. She is a widow and the mother of one child who attends school. She lives in Adidogomé.

Essi has been selling vegetables for 11 years and gets her supplies twice per month at the Agoè-Assiyeye market. She has a medium level of education and is seeking this loan to allow her to purchase three sacks of peppers and three sacks of rice. The income from her business will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of peppers and three sacks of rice.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina, age 46 and widowed, runs a small neighborhood grocery store to earn her living. She started her business 16 years ago when her husband passed away. She had two small children to raise, and she tells us it was a very trying time, but her parents stood by her, offering their emotional and financial support. 

“It was not easy at all; I kept grieving for very long time. It was tough raising the children also. I don’t know how I did it, but I had to continue living and be there for my children. I am a proud mother now: my daughter plays soccer and she gets paid when she does," Rozina tells us.

Rozina presently needs to stock up on necessary inventory items in her little grocery store. She has requested a loan in the amount of 250,000 Albanian lek. This will be her second loan, and she has proved in the past that she is an accountable borrower and a responsible person.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items in her small neighborhood grocery store

loans.name: Dagan

texts.fr: Dagan a 45 ans et vit dans le quartier Adidogomé. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants.  Dagan vend de 1987  jusqu’à 2013 les pagnes, de 2013 jusqu’à ce jour, le pagne et les chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana deux fois par mois  Elle s’occupe seule de son activité et s’y consacre 5 jours sur 7. Elle est ambulante. Elle désire avoir un soutien financier pour accroître son activité génératrice de revenu pour aider sa famille à joindre les deux bouts.
texts.en: Dagan, aged 45, lives in the Adidogomé district. She is a widow and the mother of four. Dagan has been selling ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from 1987-2013 and ‘pagne’ and shoes since 2013. She gets her supplies from Ghana twice a month. She is the only one looking after her business and devotes 5 days a week to it. She goes from place to place. She would like to have financial support to increase her revenue-generating business in order to help her family to make ends meet.

loans.use: to purchase a dozen shoes and  4 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Kiletien Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Betty, a member of the Kiletien Women Group. She is 26 years old, married, and blessed with three children. One child is in primary school and the rest are yet to join school.

She is a farmer who raises maize and beans and also does dairy farming. After joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014, she received training on business development which enabled her expand her farming business by leasing one acre so as to grow more potatoes and maize as the demand was high. 

She is borrowing money to purchase farm inputs such as manure, planting seeds, and pesticides. She looks forward to a bounty harvest and hence improved income. She plans to use the anticipated income in providing food for her household.

Betty is too grateful to kiva  and she promises to repay promptly

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticide, and planting seeds.

loans.name: Ana Edelmira

texts.es: Ana tiene 32 año de edad y se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 4 años, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, vive con su madre y su hermano en casa propia, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 32 years old and has worked selling shoes for the past 4 years. Her business is located near her house in a high-traffic area, so she has many customers. She lives with her mother and brother in their own house. With the sales she makes, she manages to cover the expenses that come up.  Ana is asking for a loan to purchase shoes in bulk to be able to have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad tiene una carnicería ubicada en el mercado municipal tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de carne, chorizo, hueso, etc. todo por mayor para poder tener mas productos, atender mejor a sus clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria, 48 years old, has a butcher shop located in the municipal market. She has many customers because of the quality of her product and her good prices. With the earnings she gets, she manages to get ahead. Maria lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She is asking for a loan to purchase meat, sausage, bones, etc. all in bulk in order to have more products, serve her customers better, and get more income.

loans.use: to purchase meat, sausage, bones, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y sus dos nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 24 años su negocio esta en su casa pero también vende de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas variedad de ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria, 49 years old, lives in her own house with her daughter, who works and helps her economically, and her two grandchildren. She has worked selling clothing for 24 years. Her business is located in her house but she also sells it as a street vendor in the various markets. She has many regular customers because of the quality of the clothing and her good prices. Maria is asking for a loan to purchase a greater variety of clothing in bulk to be able to continue with her sales, and so have more income.

loans.use: to purchase more of a variety of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано молодая и перспективная девушка. Она родилась в 1991 году. Рано является студентом 5 курса Политехнического Университета Таджикистана. Она учится по специальности программиста. Рано учится в заочное отделение и одновременно работает в заводе. Она очень трудолюбивая девушка и справляется с учебой и работой успешно. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Рано запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rano is a young woman with a lot of potential. She was born in 1991 and is now a senior at the Tajik Polytechnic University. She is studying to be a computer scientist. Rano attends the evening classes and also works at a manufacturing plants. She is a very hard working woman and is successful both in her studies and her work. She is single and lives with her parents. Rano is asking for a loan of 500 US dollars to pay for her college tuition. She waits for your kindness and hopes for you charity.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is 47 years old, married, and has six children. He has a motorcycle transport business, which he has been doing for three years. 

Job requested his third loan from VisionFund, which he will use to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. In the  future, he hopes to have a prosperous and sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Ana Ligia

texts.es:
Ana es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace más de 3 años cuando trabajaba como empleada en un taller de confección y por medio de la observación aprendió el oficio; hoy en día, a sus 59 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 2 empleos directos; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de dotación; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina recubridora, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Ana sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Ana is a dedicated and hardworking microentrepreneur. Her line of business is sewing, providing her services to third parties. It all started three years ago when she worked as an employee for a sewing shop and learned the business through experience. Today, at age 59, she already has her own shop and has created two direct employment positions. She works every day and her specialty is making trousers and dress shirts. This business allows her to generate enough resources to help her husband support their household.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying an overstitch sewing machine. This will allow her to fulfill her customers' requirements and deliver her orders on time in order to increase production and access new contracts to keep her small business going.

Ana hopes to keep strengthening her shop and to keep increasing production in order to create more job opportunities and improve both her own family's quality of life and that of the people who take part in her daily work.

loans.use: to buy an overstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Azeeman

texts.en:
Azeeman is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She has been running an animal purchase-and-sale business along with her husband. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city.

Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Azeeman has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy more animals for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more animals for resale purposes.

loans.name: Cristian Camilo

texts.es:
Cristian, de 25 años, inicio con un negocio de alquiler de juegos inflables para niños hace aproximadamente 5 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

Es un joven emprendedor, tenaz y muy trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de otros juegos inflables que le permitan mantener su servicio disponible al público y poder llevar el sustento para su hogar.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener sus estudios y ayudara con los gastos de su hogar en que vive con sus padres.

Apoya a Cristian para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Cristian, 25, started a business renting inflatable toys for children about five years ago in an effort to find an activity that would generate income to survive. 

He is a young entrepreneur, tenacious and hardworking. 

He is applying for a loan for the purchase of other inflatable toys that will allow him to keep his service available to the public and the bring money into his home. With this loan, he can maintain his studies and help with the household expenses. He lives with his parents.

Support Christian so that he can continue working!

loans.use: to purchase inflatable toys to rent out for children's parties

loans.name: Florentino Jose

texts.es:
Florentino es un hombre de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa en una humilde finca en zona rural de Monteria, Cordoba. 

Durante este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.

El se gana la vida con el oficio de construcción y con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

Sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Florentino is a man of the land who has drive and perseverance. He lives with his wife and 5 children on a humble farm in the rural zone of Monteria, Cordoba. Up until now, he has had the valor and courage to raise his children by his own means. He earns a living in construction and by raising and selling fattened pigs. He has been in this business for 10 years in order to obtain sufficient income to support his family. 

He works every day because his pigs need to be cleaned, fed and monitored constantly so they develop correctly and can be sold later on. 

He is requesting this loan to buy pigs, pellets and feed for his animals, so he can have better fed stock and they will be in better conditions for their consumption. 

He dreams of seeing his children with a career and as well educated as possible.

loans.use: To buy pigs, pellets and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Candelaria, una mujer con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio.

Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días.

Ella decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es una mujer simpática y servicial, siempre dispuesta a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

Pide un auxilio económico para comprar un amplio surtido de verduras y frutas para abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad.

Su sueño es tener un local más grande en cual pueda vender tranquilamente sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Selling fruits and vegetables is the work that Candelaria carries out, a woman with drive and perseverance to get her own business ahead.

She has worked in this business for over 10 years, starting work very early in the morning every day.

She decided to start this project when she saw the need to get more income for her family and since she didn't have sufficient education for another job, she chose to sell fruits and vegetables. 

She is a friendly and helpful woman, always ready to take care of the concerns and desires of her customers.

She asks for this economic support to purchase a wide variety of vegetables and fruits to stock up and to sell a greater quantity.

Her dream is to have a larger retail space where she can tranquilly sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Filani

texts.en: Filani is a maize farmer from kadanya Biyar village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Filani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Filani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Filani said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like childrens' school fees, food, and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Djodjina

texts.fr: Djodjina, âgée de 47 ans est de nationalité Togolaise. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés habite à Lomé  dans le quartier Adidogomé. Djodjina est revendeuse de bouillie d’akassa fabriqué à base du maïs depuis 11 ans  et s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au marche dAgoè-Assiyeye. Djodjina à un niveau secondaire. Dans le souci de réduire ces couts d’approvisionnement  et d’augmenter le résultat, Djodjina sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices ; ce crédit sera très utiles au bien être  Djodjina et de toute la famille
texts.en: Djodjina, aged 47, is a Togolese national. A married mother, she has four children, all in school. She lives in Lomé in the Adidogomé district. Djodjina has been a vendor of “akassa” porridge made from corn for eleven years. She gets her supplies twice a month from the Agoè-Assiyeye market. She has a middle school education. Concerned about reducing her supply costs and increase her output, Djodjina is requesting a loan enabling her to grow her business to make more profit. This loan will be very useful to her well-being, as well as her family’s.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of corn and a bag of sugar

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjovi, âgée de 31 ans est de nationalité Togolaise et célibataire. Adjovi habite à Lomé  dans le quartier d’adidogomé. Elle est  revendeuse de bouillie fabriqué à base du maïs et s’approvisionne 1 fois par mois au marche d’Agoè-Assiyeye. Elle à un niveau primaire. Afin de répondre plus à la demande de ses clients et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, Adjovi sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son commerce et en même temps assurer son bien être et celui de son ménage.
texts.en: Adjovi is 31 Togolese and single. She lives in Lome in the Adidogome district. She sells gruel made with corn and buys her stock once a month at the Agoè-Assiyeye market. She went to school up to the primary level. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover, Adjovi requests this loan which will enable her to expand her commerce and at the same time, assure her own well-being and that of her household.

loans.use: to buy 45 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Akoele

texts.fr: Akoele, âgée de 31 ans, vit à Lomé dans le quartier de Bè ; elle est célibataire et est commerçante de jus de fruits de 1993 à 2000, d’arachide et cahiers de 2000 à 2014. Aujourd’hui, elle  vend la boule « d’akassan » et de l'arachide. Elle la vend de manière ambulante dans les quartiers environnants. Elle est logée gratuitement par un membre de sa famille et se nourrit au plus une fois par jour. Elle est analphabète. Elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Akodesewa, deux (02) fois par mois. Elle désire avoir un soutien financier pour accroître son activité génératrice de revenus pour aider son foyer à mieux s’en sortir dans les dépenses quotidiennes et maximiser de profits.
texts.en: Akoele, age 31, lives in Lomé in the Bè district; she is unmarried and has been a merchant of fruit juices from 1993 to 2000, and of peanuts and notebooks from 2000 to 2014. Today, she sells “boules d’akassan” and peanuts. She hawks her goods in nearby neighborhoods. She is staying for free at a relative’s place and eats at least once a day. She is illiterate. She gets her supplies from the Akodesewa market twice a month. She would like to have financial support to grow her revenue-generating business to help out at home, so as to do better at managing day-to-day expenses and maximizing profits.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bowls of corn and 5 bowls of peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Altynkan

texts.ru: Алтынкан, 45 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. На протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. У Алтынкан среднее образование. По хозяйству активно помогают дети. Алтынкан достигла больших успехов в своем бизнесе. В хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 5 овец. Также есть земельный надел, 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает арбузы для реализации. Совокупная прибыль Алтынкан составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Поэтому Алтынкан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых коров, что позволит ей развить бизнес и увеличить доход от бизнес деятельности.
texts.en: Altynkan is 45, widowed, and has three children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and has grown crops and raised livestock for the past 10 years.  She's very skilled at what she does, and has had her share of success running her business.  Her children are eager to help her tend to their farm, which currently has two dairy cows and five sheep, as well as a 1.0-hectare plot of land for growing watermelons as a cash crop, while her monthly income is nearly 13,000 som.  All the same, this money isn't enough to provide a decent living for her family.  With this in mind, Altynkan is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy some purebred cows, which will allow her to grow her business and increase her income.

loans.use: buy purebred cows to increase her income

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нурила, 40 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, дети - студенты, активно помогают по хозяйству. Образование у Нурилы высшее, вместе с супругом они занимаются торговлей в собственном магазине, также дополнительно с 1994 года занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. По характеру Нурила очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, она очень общительная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы и 4 лошади. Также Нурила  выращивает на 0,60 ГА собственной земли кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации оптовым покупателям. Совокупный доход семьи составляет около 20,000 (KGS) в месяц. Нурила решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы. На прибыль от кредита Нурила планирует достроить дом и оплатить обучение ее детей в университете.
texts.en: Nurila is 40 years old, married and a mother of three children. Her kids are college students and actively help around the farm. Nurila has a college degree and owns a grocery store with her husband. They have also been farming since 1994, raising both crops and livestock. Nurila has a sweet and outgoing personality, she is very social and hard working. The family owns four cows and four horses, as well .6 hectares (1.5 acres) of land where they grow corn for both family needs and for sale. The monthly family income is 20,000 som (KGS).  Nurila has decided to expand the farming business. She has turned to "Bai Tushum" bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) so she can purchase livestock and fertilizer. Nurila plans to use the profits from this loan to finish building their house and pay for her children's college tuition.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and fertilizers for land cultivation

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ria is 36 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ria has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her pigs.

Ria has been in this business for one year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth Ileana

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una joven de 23 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tres años y actualmente solo tienen una hija de dos años.
