Decide iniciar con el abastecedor que le alquilaban ya que considera muy necesario porque  esto le permite desarrollarse en alguna actividad desde su casa y al lado de  su hija, con el fin de generar ingresos al hogar, también como meta tiene ahorrar para ingresar a la universidad que es uno de sus sueños. Este abastecedor siempre ha estado activo en la comunidad, pero la dueña decide irse a otra localidad y alquilar el establecimiento; cuando Elizabeth conoce la necesidad de que este abastecedor se encuentre funcionando para toda una comunidad que lo demanda, decide alquilarlo y empezar administrarlo con ayuda de su esposo.Inicio desde hace 4 meses con este abastecedor, gracias al apoyo de su papá que le regalo 500 000 colones para que pudiera levantar nuevamente este negocio. Requiere de este crédito para invertir en compra de abarrotes ya que la comunidad y visitantes de la zona lo requieren, debido a la falta de establecimientos en la comunidad.
Elizabeth vive en una comunidad algo retirada del centro. Existen pocas o casi nada de posibilidades de empleo, por lo que los habitantes se ven obligados a salir de la comunidad para tener un empleo que genere ingresos al hogar. En esta ocasión  Elizabeth tuvo la oportunidad de contar con este abastecedor que es un negocio activo, pero necesita mas capital para satisfacer a toda su clientela.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 23-year-old. She has been married for three years and is the mother of a 2-year-old daughter. She decided to start a business as a grocer in a space she rents. She considers it very important because the business allows her to succeed in an activity from home and close to her daughter. She works to generate income for the household as well as her goal of saving towards her dream of a university education.

This grocery store has always been active in the community but the owner decided to move to another town and rent the facility. Elizabeth recognized the need for this grocery store and is working it for the entire community that demands it. She rented it with the help of her husband. She began four months ago with the support her her dad’s gift of 500,000 Colones so she could rebuild the business. She requires a loan to invest in groceries that the community and visitors to the area require due to the lack of facilities in the community.

Elizabeth lives in a community that is some distance away from the town’s center. There are little to no employment opportunities so people are forced to leave the community to have a job that generates income for the household. This time, Elizabeth took the opportunity to turn this grocery store into an active business and needs more capital to satisfy all of her customers.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with merchandise

loans.name: Abina

texts.fr: Abina âgée de 39 ans est de nationalité Togolaise. Abina est veuve et mère  d’un enfant. Abina  habite à Lomé  dans le quartier Adidogomé. Abina est revendeuse des tissus pagnes et s’approvisionne 4 fois par mois au grand marche de Lomé. Abina à un niveau primaire. Dans le souci de réduire ces coûts d’approvisionnement  et d’augmenter le résultat, Abina sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son commerce et de subvenir au besoin du ménage.
texts.en: Abina is 39 years old and Togolese. She is a widow with one child. Abina lives in Lome in the Adidogome district. She sells traditional pagne dresses and buys her stock four times a month at the big market in Lome. She went to school up to the primary level. In order to reduce the costs of the provision of supplies, and to improve the result, Abina requests a loan which will enable her to expand her commerce at the same time as providing for her household.

loans.use: to buy five traditional pagne dresses.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad, por el momento estudia bachillerato en el instituto de su localidad, está acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 7 y 2 años, de los cuales el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor se queda con su mamá en casa.

José trabaja de locutor en una radio desde hace ya 7 años,  decidió trabajar en la radio gracias a un amigo que le brindo la ayuda para  trabajar y él no la desaprovecho gracias a esto fue como decidió trabajar  y a la ves  está estudiando el bachillerato, las clases las tiene en la mañana de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde y después a las 6 de la tarde empieza su trabajo en la radio hasta las 9 de la noche, la radio está cerca de su casa no tiene que viajar mucho a unos 5 minutos caminando.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es  para comprar 4 puertas de madera y las ventanas, pues su familia se siente insegura con las puestas ya deterioradas, gracias al préstamo podrá vivir más segura con su familia y tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.

José desea para el futuro en primer lugar seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria y poder tener un mejor trabajo y seguir remodelando su casa y ampliarla, también para sus hijos desea lo mejor que sean personas de bien en la sociedad que sigan estudiando mucho y logren sacar una carreta universitaria todo esto comenta que lo lograra con mucho trabajo y futuros créditos que sacara para seguir construyendo.
texts.en:
José is thirty years old. For now he is getting his high school diploma from the local school. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker. They have two children who are ages seven and two. The older one goes to school and the youngest stays home with his mother.

José has been working as a radio host for seven years now. He decided to work in radio thanks to a friend who helped him get started. He didn't let this opportunity pass him by so he is still working while at the same time earning his degree. Classes are from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm, and then he goes to work at the radio station from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm. The station is near his home so he doesn't have to travel far: it is about a five-minute walk.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy four wooden doors and windows, because his family feels unsafe living with the current doors, which are damaged. This loan will allow him to live more safely with his family and they will all have a better quality of life.

In the future José wants first of all to go on to college so that he can earn a degree and find a better job. He also wants to continue remodeling his home and expand it. He says he will achieve all of this by working hard and requesting other loans in the future to keep building. He also wants the best for his children, so that they become upstanding people in society. He wants them to go to school, study hard, and get a college degree.

loans.use: to buy four wooden doors and windows for his home.

loans.name: Shahbana

texts.en:
Shahbana, age 34, is a married woman. She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.

Her business is providing her with enough income to support her family. However, she needs to earn much more to meet her everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand her earnings, Shahbana has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy more baby goats for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats for resale purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy men's and women's clothing at wholesale

loans.name: Oybek

texts.ru: Ойбек родилась в 1995 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Его отец штукатурщик, а мать работает поваром. У него есть сестра, и она учится в университете. Ойбек студент 2 курса. Он учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете.  Он учиться успешно и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях. Ойбек должен оплатить за учебный договор. Его родители не имеют денег, чтобы поддержать его. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Oybek was born in 1995. He is single and lives with his parents. His father is a drywall installer and his mother works as a cook. Oybek also has a sister who also attends college. Oybek himself is a sophomore in Khunjand State University. He is a good student and actively participates in extracurricular programs. However, he needs to pay his tuition. As his parents have no money to spare, he has turned to KIVA for a loan to pay his tuition. He hopes for your kindness.|

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Maria Genoveva

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya esta su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 38 year old single mother who lives in her own home with two children. She has been making a living for the past fifteen years in agriculture, growing corn. When her crop is ready, she sells it in the surrounding villages and she already has many regular customers. 

Maria is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc and to improve the land that is shown in the photo so she can continue with her crops since that is her only source of work to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc and to improve the land.

loans.name: Nga Macha Lalonbi Jlg Group

texts.en:
Nga Macha Lalonbi group is formed by ten hard-working women who believe in themselves to achieve their own financial independence. 

Ibemma is the featured borrower of the group pictured with her hand raised. She is a strict mother and disciplines her children with good manners. They live in a village that is about 15 kilometres from the main town. She is very supportive when it comes to family matters. Her husband is a daily labourer and she is a vegetable vendor. They sustain their family from the income they get from their own businesses. She provides her children with the necessary requirements including school fees, pocket money and medical fees from the profit she earn from selling vegetables. Even though the family’s requirements are not fully met; she is a happy mother because the family members live a peaceful life. 

She sells vegetables at nearby market from morning till dusk and has an extra work transporting the vegetables from the market to her house. The family members are facing hardship since the husband quit his job due to certain health issues and they pray for his speedy recovery. Now she aspires to sell more varieties of vegetables to attract more customers. She will buy the required stock of vegetables to sell with the Kiva loan she availed herself of. She will pay for all the household requirements before the husband fully recovered and is able to work again. 

She thanks the lenders for supporting her during her times of need when otherwise she would have faced financial breakdown. She says “thank you so much for saving my family.” The rest of the group members are engaged in fishery, weaving and embroidery to support their families.

loans.use: To buy a stock of vegetables (potatoes, pea, cabbage, cauliflower, mustard leaves, brinjal) to sell in the market.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 41-year-old married woman who has been running a school for many years. She has a good number of students and is well respected in her community. She is contributing much to her family’s income through her efforts.

In order to accommodate more students in her school, Shahnaz has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to buy a couple of school benches and chairs along with a new blackboard. She expects more admissions to her school and wants to spend part of the revenues on its expansion.

loans.use: to buy a couple of school benches and chairs along with a new blackboard.

loans.name: Peninnah

texts.en:
Peninnah is 45 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 6 children. She does dairy farming and has been in the farming business for 7 years. She also has a retail shop and it has been profitable.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of dairy feed. She will also buy more stock of sugar, rice and flour to sell in her shop. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also repay the loan. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her businesses and make more income and live a happy life with her family.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed and goods to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cosmetics and beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуде 31 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Мавлуда начала свой самостоятельный бизнес после того, как вышла замуж. Она шьет национальные женские одежды. Она имеет опыт в шитье женской одежде более чем 10 лет. Она работает упорно каждый день с раннего утра до позднего вечера, чтобы предоставлять свои услуги на высшем уровне и таким образом привлекать больше клиентов. Она всегда в исследовании как развевать свой бизнес. Она должна купить вышивальную машинку, чтобы предоставлять дополнительные услуги своим клиентам. Она обратилась в ИМОН за займом в сумме 5000 сомони для покупки вышивальной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mavluda is 31 years old. She is married and has four children. Mavluda started her business when she got married - she makes traditional Tajik dresses. She has more then 10 years sewing experience and works hard every day, from dawn until dusk, so that the exceptional quality of her work will attract new clients. Mavluda also always tries to find new ways to grow her business. Currently she is looking to buy a new embroidery machine and expand the variety of services she can provide her clients with. Mavluda has turned to IMON for a loan of 5,000 somoni for this reason. She waits for your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy embroidery machine for improving business

loans.name: Shamsiyamo

texts.en:
A resident of Danghara district , 47-year-old Shamsiyamo is a mother of many children. She has four sons and two daughters. The three younger children are still in school. And the three eldest sons work with their father. They provide a service repairing houses. They also know how to make home furniture. 

Now Shamsiyamo's husband decided to start a new business, the manufacture and sale of furniture. Out of his savings he built a store near the market, where he plans to engage in manufacturing and selling furniture. His sons will help him in it. Unfortunately he lacks his own funds to purchase timber and other necessary materials to start business. 

His wife Shamsiyamo wants to help him. She applied for a loan to purchase materials. She hopes the Kiva lenders will support her and their family will be provided with a new source of income.

loans.use: to purchase timber and other necessary materials for manufacturing and selling furniture.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима добрая женщина. Благодаря своим родителям она получила педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе преподавательницей. Так как у нее маленькая зарплата, 23 лет назад, она начала свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур. Салима и ее семья также занимаются скотоводством. Ее муж и свёкор помогает по выращиванию сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Салима имеет 4 детей и всегда старается улучшить условию проживания для них. Она должна купить минеральные удобрения и горючее и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 9300 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Salima is a kind woman. Thanks to her parents she was able to get a degree in education and now works as a school teacher. As Salima's salary is very small, she also started farming 23 years ago. Her family also raises livestock. Her husband and son-in-law help raising animals and growing crops. Salima has four children and always tries to improve their living conditions. She neds to buy fertilizer and fuel, so she is taking a loan of 9300 somoni. She hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old. She is married to George and together they have been blessed with four children.George is a farmer, hence provides additional income for his family.

Margaret is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 9 years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Margaret has requested her 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 5,000 which she will use to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

With the anticipated profits, Margaret will be able to provide for her family's basic needs as well as repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become successful in farming by having a stable output through which her family can be sustained as well as additional profits realized.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 33 years old. She is married to John and together they have been blessed with one child who is 7 years old. John is employed, hence provides additional income for his family.

Linda is a poultry farmer, a business she has done for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Linda has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 which she will use to buy more chicks to rear and sell.

With the anticipated profits, Linda will be able to provide for her family's basic needs as well as repay her loan. She will also add more chicks as stock.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become successful in her business by having continuous supply of stock as well as stable increased income.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to rear and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: fertilize and care for his cocoa crop

loans.name: Ayida

texts.ru: Айида, 24 года, замужем, 2 детей. У Айиды средне-специальное образование, с 2009 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 6 овец, 3 козы, а также 1,60 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает помидоры, хлопчатник и лук. Айида известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 22,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока, скота и сельскохозяйственной продукции. Айида является участником группы "Кызыл - Туу", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Всего их трое. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку двух телят. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена купить машину для своей семьи.
texts.en: Ayida is 24 years old, married and has 2 children. Ayida has a secondary-specialized education and has been involved in agriculture since 2009. Her business consists of 2 cows, 6 sheep, 3 goats, and also 1.60 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows tomatoes, cotton and onions. Ayida is known as an honest, decent and reliable person with strong principles. Today, her business yields a monthly profit in the amount of 22,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk, livestock and agricultural products. Ayida is a participant of the "Kyzyl-Tuu" group that, besides her, is made up of two more people. There are three of them all together. In order to further develop her business, Ayida requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two calves. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to develop her business and intends to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy two calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 35 years old and married with one child.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries such as canned goods, candies, sugar, coffee, candies, noodles, and other items to sell.

Beverly has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising pigs.

Beverly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as canned goods, candies, sugar, coffee, candies, noodles, and other items to sell

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is 19 years old and is a single lady living with her family. She is a university student majoring in Engineering, and she is in her first year. 

Ruba is aiming to find a job in her study field after graduating. 

She is now asking for your help to pay for her upcoming semester fees by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Fahmi

texts.en:
Fahmi was born in 1970. He is a married man living with his eight family members. Fahmi is the only provider for his family. He seeking to provide his children with the best education. One of his daughters' is a university student majoring in Hospital Management, and she is in her first year.  

She is seeking to expand her studies till she gets her masters' in the future. But because Fahmi is currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping him in paying his daughter's upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Gulkan

texts.ru: Гулькан, 53 года, замужем, дети взрослые, самостоятельные, младшая дочь - студентка. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, много лет назад Гулькан начала свой сельскохозяйственный бизнес. Благодаря упорному труду Гулькан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы и 2 лошади. Также есть 1,29 ГА собственной земли, где Гулькан выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья дойных коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса и строительство сарая для скота.
texts.en: Gulkan is 53 years old and married.  Her children are all grown up and living on their own, and her youngest daughter is a student.  While looking for ways to earn money for her family, Gulkan started her own farming business several years ago.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has four cows and two horses on her farm, as well as 1.29 hectares of land for growing barley, while her monthly income is roughly 10,000 som.  To further develop her farm, she's seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy some dairy cows, and plans on using her extra income due to the loan to further expand her business and build a new barn for her animals.

loans.use: buy dairy cows to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is an ambitious 23-year-old young man living with his family in Ajloun, Jordan. He is a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems, and he is in his last year.  

Mohammad is seeking to work in his field after getting his Bachelors’. Now he is applying for this loan to be able to pay for his upcoming semester fees which he couldn’t pay because of the financial crisis his family has been facing.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla is 36 years old, single and she has no children. She does dairy farming and has been in the farming business for 13 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow and get more milk to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her farming business and make more income

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a married woman with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbours and college students. She faces a challenge of seasonality, especially during holiday seasons when schools have closed and she experiences a low number of customers. With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase manicure, pedicure and facial kits, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase manicure, pedicure and facial kits, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food.

loans.name: Lilliane

texts.en:
Lilliane is 25-years-old. She is married to Willis and together they have been blessed with two children and taking care of one other who is an orphan. The ages of these children are 14, 3, and 2 years respectively.  Willis is self-employed hence provides additional income for his family.

Lilliane runs a retail shop, a business she has done for the last year earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Lilliane has requested her 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 which she will use to add stock of retail goods like minute-maid soft drinks, sodas, bales of maize flour, baking flour, milk and bread for sale.

With the anticipated profits Lilliane will be able to provide for her family's basic needs as well add more stock to her shop.

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to become successful in her business by having continuous supply of stock as well as stable income.

loans.use: to add stock of retail goods

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hellena operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with one child. She sells milk and has been in this business for three years.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of milk to supply to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more milk to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Abdias

texts.es:
Abdias es un joven muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Ucayali junto a su familia.
Con mucho esfuerzo estudió la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma y actualmente ejerce su profesión en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad. Desde muy joven se ha esforzado por el bienestar de su familia, siempre queriendo lo mejor para ellos, por eso día a día se esfuerza al máximo para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Abdias está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse una moto para poder movilizarse de su trabajo al campo para supervisar y hasta su casa, con esto ahorrará en pasajes, el cual podrá destinarlos para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Abdias is a self-motivated young man who is eager to be successful. He is single and he lives in Ucayali with his family. He studied Agricultural Engineering with a great deal of effort and now he practices his profession at an agricultural company in his city. 

Since he was very young he had made an effort for the well-being of his family, always wanting the best for them, which is why each day he tries his hardest to be able to give them a better future.

Abdias is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have given him, he will be able to buy a motorcycle to get him from work to the countryside to supervise and to his house. This way he will save on transit tickets, which will allow him to continue improving the lives of his family members and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy a mode of transportation to get to work.

loans.name: Moise Antonio

texts.es:
Moise de 23 años de edad, ya  egreso de la universidad de una licenciatura en computación no está casado ya que se ha dedicado al estudio.

Moise no tiene ningún negocio ya que a estado estudiando y solo terminara la tesis para poder graduarse.
El financiamiento lo necesita para los gastos que tendrá en la elaboración de la tesis y también para ayudarle a su padre para que pueda abonar el  cultivo de maíz.

Su sueño es formar su familia y trabajar para poder tener sus cosas en su hogar.
texts.en:
Moise, who is 23 years old, has already left the university with a degree in computer sciences. He is not married, since he has dedicated himself to his studies.

Moise has no business, since he has been studying, and he only needs to finish his thesis in order to be able to graduate.

He needs the financing for the expenses that he will have in preparing his thesis and also to help his father so that he can apply compost to his corn crop.

His dream is to form a family and work in order to be able to have his things in his home.

loans.use: to pay the expenses that he will have in preparing his thesis and also to help his father so that he can fertilize his corn crop.

loans.name: Rwerere Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Plaxeda is the lady on the left side of the photo. She is married with four children who attend school. She resides at Kihumuro village, where she operates a mobile money business. Besides this business, she is also a small-scale farmer who sells some of her output. However, she is challenged with limited capital so she decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance so as to expand her business and earn more income.

Plaxeda applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) to improve and develop agriculture through buying tomato and cabbage seeds, as well as pesticides. With this, she is sure to meet her need at this time when the planting season is going on.

She thanks Ugafode, in partnership with Kiva, for the financial support rendered to her and the fellow group members and aims at meeting market demands using this loan. She praises Ugafode for supporting people who do agriculture on a small scale. The sixth member is not taking a loan but is saving with the group though she signed the waiver form.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three sheep in order to develop her business and increase her income

loans.name: Irodahon

texts.ru: Иродахон 20 лет, замужем, детей нет. У Иродахон - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Иродахон есть 2 коровы, 4 овцы, также 1,8 ГА поливной земли, где Иродахон выращивает хлопчатник и морковь. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 22,000 сом (KGS). Накопленные средства Иродахон старается вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса. Иродахон является участником группы "Кызыл - Туу", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку трех овец для увеличения поголовья скота и минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы. Таким образом, Иродахон инвестирует в свой бизнес, и сможет накопить средства на покупку квартиры.
texts.en: Irodahon is 20 years old, married and has no children. Irodahon has a secondary-specialized education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in agriculture. Today her business consists of 2 cows, 4 sheep, and also 1.8 hectares of irrigated land, where Irodahon grows cotton and carrots. Her monthly income amounts to about 22,000 som (KGS). Irodahon tries to invest her savings into the development and expansion of her business. Irodahon is a participant of the "Kyzyl-Tuu" group that is made up of two more people. She requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy three sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount and also to buy mineral fertilizers for treating the soil. This way Irodahon will invest in her business and be able to save money to buy an apartment.

loans.use: to buy three sheep and mineral fertilizers for land cultivation

loans.name: Gardinia

texts.en:
Gardinia is a 21 year old, university student majoring in Chemistry, and she is in her third year. Her father is a trading man working outside the country. Gardinia  lives with her family that consists of six members. 

She is seeking to get her Bachelors’ so that she can improve her studies and start her Masters’ journey. 

Now she is applying for this loan to be able to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr: Emefa , âgée de 26 ans est de nationalité Togolaise. Elle est mariée et mère  de deux  enfants  qui est scolarisé. Emefa habite à Lomé  dans le quartier Adidogomé. Emefa est revendeuse de condiments : gingembre  depuis 4 ans.  Emefa se fait livrer les marchandises  2 fois par mois à domicile. Emefa a un niveau primaire. Emefa sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son commerce afin de répondre à la demande. Les valeurs ajoutées de ce crédit, permettra à Emefa d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emefa is 26 years old and from Togo. She is married and the mother of two children who attend school.

Emefa lives in Lomé in the Adidogomé neighborhood. She has been a reseller of spices, namely ginger, for 4 years. Emefa has her supplies delivered to her home twice per month. 

Emefa has a primary school level of education. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to grow her business and respond to her customers' needs. The added benefits of this loan will allow her to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 1.5 bags of ginger

loans.name: Afi Ahoefa

texts.fr: Ahoéfa  âgée de 32 ans est de nationalité Togolaise. Ahoéfa est célibataire et mère  d’un enfant scolarisé. Ahoéfa  habite à Lomé  dans le quartier Adidogomé. Ahoéfa est revendeuse des tissus pagnes depuis 6 ans   et s’approvisionne 4 fois par mois au grand marche de Lomé. Ahoéfa à un niveau secondaire. Dans le souci de réduire ses coûts d’approvisionnement  et d’augmenter le résultat, Ahoéfa sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son commerce et de subvenir au besoin du ménage.
texts.en:
Ahoéfa is 32 years old and from Togo. She is unmarried and the mother of one child who attends school. Ahoéfa lives in Lomé in the Adidogomé neighborhood. 

Ahoéfa has been a reseller of "pagne" cloth for 6 years and gets her supplies 4 times per month at the big market in Lomé. She has a secondary level of education.

In order to reduce her costs of provisioning supplies and to increase her profits, Ahoéfa is requesting a loan which will allow her to grow her business and to provide for the needs of her household.

loans.use: to purchase 3 pieces of "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don Juan vive con su compañera de vida y su hijastro. El posee una venta de jarrones y otras obras artesanales es muy conocido por la zona pues su trabajo es muy artístico, bonito, de excelente calidad y sobre todo a muy buen precio, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, quiere abastecer mas su negocio con las artesanías que realiza, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar arcilla, pintura, y barniz. Para seguir con su trabajo y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Juan Antonio lives with his life partner and stepson. He has a stall where he sells vases and other craftwork.  He is well known in the area because his work is very artistic, beautiful, of excellent quality and, above all, sold at a great price.  He has a lot of customers lately, and wants to stock up his business with more of the craftwork he creates.  As such, he is requesting INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy clay, paint, and varnish, to continue his work and attain higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint, and varnish.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
A wonderful and hardworking woman from Tajikistan, Hanifa is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders because she needs financial support. She must buy women's clothes to sell.

Hanifa has been busy with buying and selling women's clothes in a local market for more than 3 years. She sells variety of women clothes. Every season, she renews the assortment of her goods and little by little develops her business.

Hanifa is the only provider of her two children because she is divorced. Her former husband doesn’t help her with providing their children with all of the necessary things. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS) to buy women's clothes for new season. She awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for new season.

loans.name: Doris Nataly

texts.es:
Doris es una joven muy emprendedora que siempre se preocupa por sacar adelante a su familia, es por ello que está trabajando como ayudante en un restaurante de su ciudad natal, Ica. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una profesión ya que la economía en su casa es baja, por ello se puso a trabajar desde muy joven. En sus tiempos libres también apoya a su mamá en los quehaceres del hogar y en su trabajo como obrera de campo, es una hija muy ejemplar para sus hermanos y sus vecinos porque prefiere sacrificarse por el bienestar de su familia.
Doris está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá arreglar su casa que a la fecha es pre-fabricada y ella quiere tener mayor seguridad y comodidad,así continuará con su labor diaria para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Doris is a very enterprising young woman who is always trying to get her family ahead, which is why she is working as a helper in a restaurant in her hometown, Ica. Sadly, she was not able to study at the university because the income at home is low, which is why she began working from a young age.

In her free time, Doris helps her mother with the chores at home and in helps her mother with her work as a farm worker. She is great example to her brothers and her neighbors because she sacrifices a lot for the wellbeing of her family.

Doris is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given her, she will be able to fix up her house that is currently pre-fabricated, and she wants to have more safety and comfort. She will continue working daily to improve the quality of life for her loved ones.

loans.use: to fix up her pre-fabricated house for improved security and comfort.

loans.name: Sapenzia

texts.en:
Sapenzia is 66 years old. She is married to Ong'ayo and together they have been blessed with four children. She supports her entire family including her husband.

Sapenzia sells secondhand clothes, a business she has done for the last 25 years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000.

Sapenzia has requested KES 45,000 for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to add more bales of secondhand clothes for resale

With the anticipated profits Sapenzia will be able to provide for her family's basic needs as well as repay her loan. She will also be able to increase her income to even start another business.

Sapenzia's hopes and dreams for the future are to become successful in her business and to support her family more stably.

loans.use: to add more bales of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dubaris Enit

texts.es:
Hace un año empezó el sueño de Dubarís, cuando inicio su negocio de venta de gallinas, dulces y bebidas como medida para mejorar la calidad de vida, pues vive en una zona y casa con altos índices de pobreza y no tienen muchas oportunidades en el sector.
Dubarís quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido en gallinas, refrescos y dulces, ella buscara a toda costa mejorar sus condiciones de vida y darle a su hijo de 8 años un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Dubaris' dream began a year ago, when she set up her business of selling hens, sweets, and beverages as a way to improve her quality of life, since she lives in a zone and house with high indices of poverty, and there aren't many opportunities in the sector.

Dubaris wants to apply for a loan to purchase a stock of hens, soft drinks, and sweets. She will seek at any cost to improve her living condition and give her 8-year-old son a promising future.

loans.use: to buy hens, sweets, and soft drinks. Damaris lives in a zone very affected by violence and poverty, and she wants to work to improve her life.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru: Гулнар 55 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Гулнар высшее образование. С 1980 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. В хозяйстве Гулнар есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. Также земельный надел мерою 0,31 ГА, где Гулнар выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячная прибыль Гулнар составляет 15,000 сом(KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 25,000 сом(KGS) на покупку 1 коровы. Доходы от кредита Гулнар направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что позволит в будущем построить сарай для содержания скота.
texts.en: Gulnar is 55, married, and has three children.  She has a university education, and has grown crops and raised livestock since 1980, becoming very skilled at it over time.  Everyone in the family is eager to do their part in running their farm, which currently has four cows, ten sheep, and two horses, as well as 0.31 hectares of land for growing barley, while her monthly income is nearly 15,000 som.  To increase her livestock headcount, she is seeking a loan of 25,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy a dairy cow, and plans on using any extra income due to the loan to further grow her business, which will eventually allow her to build a new barn for her animals.

loans.use: buy a cow to be more profitable

loans.name: Cleope

texts.en:
Cleope is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cleope is 41-years-old and has three children who are in school.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Cleope requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Cleope has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Cleope would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Kishanda Tukore Namani Group

texts.en:
Peter, with a stripped t- shirt in the group photo, is a male adult who is 30-years-old and a member of Kishanda Tukore Namani group made up of 15 members, with two of them without loans but are saving, who are taking a loan of 6,000,000. Peter is married with 2 children and a resident of Kishanda cell, Nyakinengo, Rukungiri district.  

He didn’t acquire enough education and he decided to engage himself in productive agriculture of cattle trade and poultry to be able to support his family. He later found out that the money from poultry was not enough to meet all his family's financial needs and decided to join Kishanda Tukore Namani group in order to borrow loan funds. 

The purpose of this loan was to buy more poultry birds and also buy their feed. He is optimistic they will be ready for sell during Christmas time when the demand is high, therefore increasing his income. He and the group members are grateful for the support offered by Ugafode and Kiva funders.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Afliana

texts.en: Afliana is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She will use the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as salt, candies, coffee, matches, eggs, soy sauce, sugar and other things to sell including soft drinks. Afliana started to open her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $800. She is taking this loan because her working capital is not enough, so she wants to use the loan to add to her working capital. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy salt, candies, coffee, matches, eggs, soy sauce, sugar and other things to sell including soft drinks.

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en: Tukur is a maize farmer from Liman village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tukur would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tukur can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Tukur said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees and food and farm loan repayment, eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Liman

texts.en: Liman Rufai is a maize farmer from Katsalle village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Liman Rufai can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Liman Rufai said: “I will now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees and food and farm loan repayment, eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen Del Carmen está en su ciclo número  3 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando por mejorar.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Olga, quien se dedica a la venta variada de joyas, es una persona muy trabajadora, que se hizo de muy buena clientela gracias a la variedad que tiene. Quiere seguir creciendo en su trabajo para poder ayudar a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
La Sra. Olga pide este préstamo para la compra de joyas variadas para la venta, ella y sus compañeras de grupo agradecen la oportunidad que reciben de seguir con su trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen del Carmen” is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members are also participating in the poverty elimination program. These female heads of household are striving to improve.

One of the members is Sra. Olga, who sells various types of jewelry. She is a hardworking individual who has built up a very good clientele thanks to the variety that she offers. Olga wants to keep growing in her work so that she can help her family as she has always done.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of jewelry to sell. Sra. Olga and her fellow group members appreciate the opportunity they have received so that they can continue their work and their efforts.

loans.use: to buy various types of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 8 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Estela is 39 years old; she lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters.

For 8 years she has been selling personal use products. Her business is located in her home and she also sells in the streets of the different towns.

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc., everything in bulk and thus be able continue with her work and have better earnings.

loans.use: buy perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc., everything in bulk

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net, bamboo, etc.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, nails, etc.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood and nails to make furniture

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora is married and has a fish pond operator business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her fish.

Leonora has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old, married, and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Maricel has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 31-years-old and married.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jennifer has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dongphou Group

texts.en: Alee's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in Alee's village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Alee is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. Even though some people in the village, including Alee’s, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Alee and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal or wood and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Alee's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dongfaivan Group

texts.en:
Channee is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. Channee's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. Even though some people in the village, including Channee, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases disposable income to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water.

Channee and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. Channee's filter is guaranteed for two years, though most users find the filter works from three to five years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. Increasing time available for productive work also improves a family’s income and overall well being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water tanks and water pipes

loans.name: Naheuang Group

texts.en:
Khamvan's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village, including Khamvan, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Khamvan is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Khamvan due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing  the amount of money used to  purchase bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works from 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.ru:
Лидия замужем. У нее есть взрослые дети. Лидия имеет свой бизнес.

Лидия занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении 21 года. Она выращивает ранние и поздние овощи: помидоры, огурцы и пекинскую капусту. Лидия ответственная и трудолюбивая. Она хочет развивать бизнес, чтобы увеличить доход семьи.

Лидия просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на постройку двух новых теплиц взамен инзношеных старых. Благодаря кредиту она сможет получить хорошую прибыль в новом сезоне с продажи  ранних овощей.
texts.en:
Lidiya is married and has adult children. She has been running her own greenhouse business for 21 years. She grows both early and late season vegetables: tomatoes, cucumbers and Napa cabbage. She is responsible and hardworking and wants to develop her business in order to increase her family's income.

Lidiya is requesting a loan of 40,000 griven to build two new greenhouses to replace old ones. Thanks to the loan she will be able to receive a good profit in the new season with her vegetable sales.

loans.use: to build two new greenhouses

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 29-year-old man married to Truphosa, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.

George has been operating a pig-raising business for a period of five years, earning himself an income of KES 7,000 at the end of every month. He is now servicing his third loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy additional pigs and feeds.

George plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to provide the best education to his children.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Melinda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing. Alicia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 33-years-old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Emelyn has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and vegetables.

Emelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

Corazon has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en:
Myassar is a 53-year-old, married, woman and a mother of seven sons and daughters. She has been helping her husband in improving their living conditions for seven years by selling traditional clothes called ‘abayas’ to her neighbors and friends. Because this business was profitable, Myassar is seeking to open her own shop in the future. 

Now, she wants to expand her business by bringing in more abayas. To do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and abayas to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores es un hombre  de 65 años de edad, solo estudio sexto grado. La esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos tienen 5 hijos y ya todos tienen su propio hogar
Dolores se dedica a la agricultura sostenible desde que tenía 18 años de edad, ya que su padre le enseño a trabajar la tierra; también tiene sus vacas. El horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 1pm.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar abono  para aplicárselo al cultivo de maíz y así poder obtener una buena cosecha.
Su sueño es dar a sus hijos un buen ejemplo como un padre trabajador que pese a todas dificultades de la vida a salido adelante.
texts.en:
Dolores is a 65 year old man, who studied up to sixth grade. His wife takes care of household chores and they have 5 children,  all of whom have their own homes.  
 
Dolores has worked in sustainable agriculture since he was 18 years old, and his father taught him how to work the land.  He also has cows.  His working hours are from 6am to 1pm. The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizer to apply it to corn cultivation, and thereby obtain a good harvest. 

His dream is to provide a good example for his children of a hard working father who despite all life difficulties was able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for corn cultivation and thereby obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and lumber to build a new roof for his house.

loans.name: Fibilus

texts.en: Filibus is a maize farmer from Dan'asabe village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Filibus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Filibus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Filibus said, “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en: Fernanda lives in Dili. She is married and has two children. She has been doing business since 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store, such as aqua, biscuits, cigarettes and other things to sell including soft drinks. She sells in her house and she also sells with a three-wheeler. There are four members in the family including her husband and her two children. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy aqua, biscuits, cigarettes and other things to sell including soft drinks.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Los Hombres forman parte importante en el fortalecimiento de un país para su desarrollo. Futuros profesionales en los diversos campos laborales de la vida y de nuestro país, el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado, el se a propuesto sacar su familia adelante en el sistema económica el tiene 6 hijos, 4 de ellos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad y los otros 2 de ellos le ayudan en los cultivos.

La actividad que el dignamente realiza es la agricultura campo que le ha venido abriendo puertas para nuevas oportunidades en la vida para poder llegar a ser alguien mejor en un futuro y por medio de lo que realiza el puede tener un ingreso económico para el sustento diario de su familia, los ingresos la obtiene con la siembra de cebolla que lo realizan en su comunidad, el eligió esta actividad porque hay pocas personas que se dedican a dicha actividad y por lo tanto es muy rentable, la segunda actividad que el   realiza es  de jornalero.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de semillas de cebolla y fertilizantes para sembrarlas y así obtener mejores ingresos económicos, los sueños de el es la ampliación de su siembra de cebollas para que le generen más ingresos económicos para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Men play an important role in strengthening a country through its development. There are future professionals in the various fields of work in life and our country. Felix is 55 years old and married. He aims to support his family in the economic system. He has six children. Four of them are excellent students at the nearby school, and the other two help Felix with the crops.

The activity he carries out with dignity is farming. This field has opening up doors for him in the form of new life opportunities allowing him to be a better person in the future. It also enables him to make an income to support his family. He makes his earnings through growing onions in his community. He chose this line of work because there are not many people who do it and as a result, it is very profitable. He also works as a day laborer.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy onion seeds and fertilizer, to grow onions so that he can boost his income. Felix dreams of increasing his onion crop to make more money for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
De 46 años de edad  en su estado civil  soltera con dos hijos,  siendo el primero de 17 años de edad estudiante en la escuela de la comunidad y el segundo de 10 año de edad también estudiante,  por los cuales tiene ese deseo de superarse en la vida para hacer alguien diferente en un futuro ella comenta que no hoy edad para emprender cualquier tipo de actividad sino el deseo de superar.  

La actividad que dignamente desempeña para poder obtener ingresos y ganancias económicas es la realización de compra de abarrotería y venta de productos de abarrotería que se encuentra ubicado en su comunidad, ella eligió dicha actividad porque a tenido la oportunidad  de haber trabajado 6 años en dicha actividad y que si deja buena ganancia económica.

El motivo principal de la realización del préstamo es para poder comprar productos de abarrotería para poder obtener un ingreso económico y así mismo el ingreso de las ganancias para mantener un sistema económico y apoyar el desarrollo de su comunidad y la de su familia.

Sus metas personales en la vida y en los años próximos es obtener ganancias que estima de su negocio y en ampliar su negocio en la compra de más locales en el centro de su comunidad y en darles una educación mejor a sus hijos para que lleguen a ser  buenos profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
She is 46, single, with two children. The eldest is 17, a student in the community school, and the other is 10 and is also a student.  It is for them that she has the desire to better herself in life and  make a different person of herself. She says that it doesn't matter what age you are when you start to do something, but what matters is the desire to better yourself.  

The occupation which she carries out with dignity to obtain income and profits is selling grocery products from the grocers she has bought in her community. She chose to do this because she's had the opportunity to work in this employment for 6 years, and it is profitable.

The main purpose of the loan is to be able to buy grocery products to improve both  her income and her profits, as well as support the economy and support the development of her community and her family.

Her personal goal in life and in the coming years is to obtain her estimated profits from the business and to expand her business by buying more shops in the center of her community. Another goal is to provide her children with a better education so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy products for a grocery shop.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is married and she has 4 children. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she is very interested in her business. She has been involved in business activities since 2010 with her own working capital of $250. She is earning good money but she still wants to improve her management of her business.  

So she took a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more additional items to keep in her store including sugar, coffee, noodles, sardines, milks, biscuits, lighters, oils, wax and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, noodles, sardines, milks, biscuits, lighters, oils, wax and other things to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena lives in Dili and she is a business woman. She is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a business shop where many people come to buy every day. Helena has been involved in business activities since in 2011, she started with her own working capital of $ 300.  She is earning a good income from her business so she is still happy to do her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more including biscuits, soap, Aqua and other things to sell Including soft drinks

loans.use: To buy biscuits, soap, Aqua and other things to sell including soft drinks

loans.name: Deuzinha

texts.en: Deuzinha is married and she has 2 children. She has a very high interest in doing business, so she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has been involved in business activities since 2009 and she started with a working capital of $100. She is earning good money every day so with this loan she wants to improve her business. She takes the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional items to keep in her store including candy, ABC coffee, donuts and soft drinks. She is hopes with this loan she can grow her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une revendeuse  âgée de 52 ans. Elle est veuve et mère  de quatre enfants  scolarisés. Elle  habite à Lomé  dans le quartier Adidogomé . Amélé est une restauratrice et prépare ses mets à base du maïs localement appelé "Com". Elle passe 3 heures de temps pour la transformation et la préparation de ce repas. Elle a plus de 14 ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de cette activité et dispose de beaucoup de clients fidèles.Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé. Dans l’optique d'améliorer sa condition et de vie et celle de ses enfants, Amélé  sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 17 bols de maïs.
texts.en:
Amélé is a 52-year-old vendor. She is a widow and the mother of four children who attend school. She lives in Lomé, in the Adidogomé neighborhood.

Amélé sells food and prepares a corn-based dished locally known as "Com." She spends three hours preparing these meals. She has more than 14 years of experience running this business and has many loyal customers. She gets her supplies once a month at the Adidogomé market. With the goal of improving her living conditions and those of her children, Amélé is seeking this loan to purchase 17 bowls of corn.

loans.use: To purchase 17 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 24 years. She is single and currently has no children to support. She runs a salon, a business she has been in for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

Lucy has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 30,000, which she will use add stock of hair spray, hair relaxers, hair extensions and shampoo to her salon.

With the anticipated profits, Lucy will be able to expand her business even further by purchasing more supplies as well as repaying her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become successful and to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to add stock of hair spray, hair relaxers, hair extensions and shampoo

loans.name: Aladinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALADINAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de meriendas, producción de papa, venta de frutas, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, servicio de electricista, venta de comida, venta de CD’s, costura de chamarras, costura de deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s.; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de  al observar que en el mercado estos productos son ampliamente comercializados decide invertir sus ahorros en la mercadería.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de CD’s por mayor) que lo adquirirá de la frontera Perú - Bolivia, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Aladinas” will begin the fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Office. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a governing board of which Miriam is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied. Among them are: snack sales, potato production, fruit sales, a neighborhood store, cosmetics sales, electrician services, food sales, CD sales, sewing coats, and sewing sportswear.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microentrepreneurs of which Miriam is a member. She indicates that twelve years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling CDs. She lets it be known that she learned this business by observing that in the market these products are sold extensively and decided to invest her savings in the merchandise.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase in her merchandise (the purchase of CDs wholesale), which she will acquire from border between Peru and Bolivia. Subsequently, she will sell it in her selling space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has one child.

When she is consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she like the area of health and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase CDs wholesale.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda is a 31-year-old homemaker with three children who lives in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. One of the children attends school. Her husband is 32, an ice seller earning $12 a day. To help her husband’s business, Chenda would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle with a trailer to transport ice. With this loan, her husband’s business will get better. In the future, she is going to build fences around her house and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle with a trailer to transport ice

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Arlene is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ernesto De Jesus

texts.es:
Ernesto es un experimentado carpintero el cual a sus 15 años aprendió su oficio gracias a sus tíos y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual gracias a dios y a pesar de las adversidades ha logrado salir junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido su propia casa de madera donde vive actualmente con sus padres, construyo los muebles y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.
 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina Ruteadora y madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por ellos. 

Su principal sueño es enfocado en su estudio puesto que vive en una zona donde la educación es de muy difícil acceso. 

Ernesto quiere ir a una universidad y en un futuro no muy lejano ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Ernesto is an experienced carpenter, who learned the trade at the age of 15 thanks to his uncles. He became independent over time, eventually setting up his own workshop. Thanks to God and despite the adversities, it is through this workshop that he, together with his family, has managed to get ahead.

His proudest achievement is having built his own wooden house, where he currently lives with his parents. He built the furniture, and almost everything that can be found in his humble home has been built by him.

He is requesting a loan to buy a router and wood, which will enable him to make more furniture and gain good profits from its sale.

His main dream is centered on his studies because he lives in an area where access to education is very difficult.

Ernesto wants to go to university and become a professional in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a router and wood, which will enable him to make more furniture to sell.

loans.name: Egnoname

texts.fr: Egnoname, âgée de 27 ans est de nationalité Togolaise et célibataire. Egnoname habite à Lomé  dans le quartier Adidogomé.
