texts.es: Vital tiene 37 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el posee desde hace 3 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Vital está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vital is 37 years old and lives with his life partner and his son in a house of his own. He has had a store at home for three years. He has many customers because of his good prices and because he is kind to them.

Vital is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, grains, beverages, sweets, sweet bread, etc. and be able to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, grains, beverages, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 47 years old and married. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 11 years. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory, so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion, for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She became a member of PMPC in 2011, and she has obtained loans previously from PMPC, to purchase additional stock. Now she is applying for another loan, for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her store's stock, to increase inventory and sales

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia has been considerably preparing for the post-harvest operations of her palay (unhusked rice) crop in Lopez Jaena. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. Rosalia presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and took out a loan. Rosalia hopes to see her family in good and comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Emérita Santos

texts.es:
Emérita de 32 años de edad,  alcanzo un estudio hasta el 3º grado de educación básica,  su compañero de vida desempeña la labor de agricultor y de albañil. Juntos trabajan la tierra desde hace mucho tiempo, ellos actualmente tienen una pequeña hija de 5 años de edad.

 Emérita trabaja en los oficios domésticos de su hogar,  hace 5 meses vendía ropa en las casas aledañas a la comunidad, y por motivos de salud dejo de hacerlo, es por eso que tomo la decisión de estar en el hogar con su hija y ayudarle a su esposo en su labor de agricultor.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono para la milpa, sulfato, el cual es un elemento muy importante para la misma y un muy buen fertilizante.

A futuro Emérita desea volver a constituir su negocio, volver otra vez a vender ropa y así ayudar en un ingreso mas para su hogar.
texts.en:
Emérita, 32, finished elementary school. Her life partner is a crop farmer and construction worker. Together they've worked in the fields for many years. They have a little, 5-year-old daughter.

Emérita is a housewife. Five months ago, she sold clothing in the neighboring areas of the community and for health reasons had to stop. That's why she decided to stay at home with her daughter and help her husband with the farming.

The loan she is requesting is to buy manure for the crops, sulfate, which is a very important element for farming and also a good fertilizer.

In the future, Emérita would like to restart her business and go back to clothing sales and help generate another income for her household.

loans.use: buy manure for the crop and sulfate, which is an important element for the crop and good fertilizer.

loans.name: Hera

texts.en: Hera, 54 years old, is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past eleven years, Hera has operated a tricycle repair shop business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment. In the future, Hera would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a variety of clothing items and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nghĩa

texts.en:
Nghĩa is 57 years old and is married with 3 children. Nghĩa lives in a rural town in Quang Xuong district, in Thanh Hoa province.

Nghĩa works in agriculture, farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Nghĩa faces in her life is not having money to repair her latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy equipment for a toilet and bathroom. This is Nghĩa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Nghĩa hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business will do well, and that her children will find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri, 41 years old, is married to Arnaldo, 39 years old. They are blessed with 2 sons: Gilbert, 14, in his third year of junior high school and Orlando, 8, a third grade student in elementary school. Sri is a housewife and her husband is a civil servant. Beside taking care of her family, Sri runs two different types of businesses: renting rooms and selling "batik" clothes.

Sri has been running the room rental business since 2007. She started the business with 6 rooms; she then built 5 more rooms in a different location in 2010. In the same year, she also tried another venture by selling "batik" clothes. Her two businesses are running well. Recently, Sri's stocks of clothes have been sold out. However, she needs to purchase more stock since many customers have ordered clothing. Sri has therefore applied for an individual loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM to buy stocks of clothes (batik).

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes (batik) to be sold

loans.name: Maria Dinorath

texts.es: Dinorath de 36 años de eada, se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 9 años y ya tiene clientes fijos que la prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, ella vive con su esposo en casa propia, Dinorath está solicitando un crédito para comprar mas semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dinorath is 36 years old. She sells roasted cashew seeds, and she's been doing this for 9 years. 

She has an steady clientele that like her because she offers good quality products at a good price.

She lives with her husband in their own house. 

Dinorath is requesting the loan to buy more cashew seeds at wholesale price to be able to keep working, and to  have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more cashew seeds at wholesale price.

loans.name: Bebiyereye Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA est responsable du groupe BEBIYEREYE. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 01va à l’école.
Mme vend des habits, chaines et chaussures depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne en cote d’Ivoire.
Elle veut s’acheter 10pièces de pagnes, 05douzaines de chaussures et 05douzaines de chaines.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider à l’épanouissement de la famille et voir construire une maison d’habitation. Elle ambitionne devenir une grossiste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rasmata is leader of the Beiyereye group. She is married and the mother of three. Her eldest child is 30 years old, and the youngest is 13. One of her children is still in school.

Mrs. Rasmata has been selling clothing, necklaces and shoes for 15 years. She stocks up in Cote D’Ivoire. 
She would like to buy 10 sets of traditional “pagnes” fabric, five dozens of shoes and five dozens of necklaces.
With her revenues, she would like to help improve her family’s life conditions and have a house built for her family to live in. Her goal is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy 10 sets of traditional “pagnes” fabric, five dozens of shoes and five dozens of necklaces in order to help support her family.

loans.name: Zeinegul

texts.ru: Зейнегул, 48 лет, есть сын, образование - средне-специальное. Зейнегул с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, также она продает молочную продукцию. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Зейнегул есть 3 коровы, 13 овец, лошадь. На земельном наделе мерою 1,85 ГА она выращивает картофель для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Зейнегул составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зейнегул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка 20 овец на общую сумму 100,000 сом (KGS), оставшиеся средства Зейнегул направит на ремонт дома. Доходы от кредита Зейнегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, ее сын - студент, поэтому всю прибыль она направит на его образование.
texts.en: Zeinegul is 48, has a son, and has the equivalent of a high school education with some vocational training.  Since 1995, she's been farming crops, raising livestock, and selling dairy products for a living.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has three cows, thirteen sheep, and a horse on her farm, as well as 1.85 hectares of land for growing potatoes as a cash crop, and her monthly income is roughly 10,000 som.  To further develop her business, she's seeking a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy 20 sheep, and will use any leftover money for home repairs.  She plans on using her extra income due to the loan to further expand her business and help pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep in order to invest in her business and for the part of loan repair her house

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie, 40 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. Julie is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past seven years, Julie has operated a business making and selling chicken boxes in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Julie would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: María Celestina

texts.es:
María se dedica a la venta de pan y tamales los fines de semana, desde hace 2 años se dedica a este negocio, ella dice que tomo la decisión para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y poder sacar adelante sus hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería con ayuda de su nieto.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar medicina para ella y la otra parte para comprar el material para su negocio de elaboración de pan y tamales.

El sueño de María ha sido siempre sacar adelante su familia y darles los mejor y ella espera en un futuro obtener un crédito mas grande en CREDICAMPO y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María makes a living selling bread and tamales at the weekend. She has had this business for two years. She says that she made the decision to help her husband with the household expenses and support her children. Her husband makes a living in agriculture and livestock with the help of his grandson. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy herself medicine and buy materials for her business making bread and tamales.

María has always dreamed of supporting her family and giving them the best. In the future, she hopes to get a bigger loan from CREDICAMPO, so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herself medicine and to buy materials for her business making bread and tamales.

loans.name: Roern's Group

texts.en:
Roern, 47, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last 27 years, Roern has been farming rice. The current business earns her about 60,000KHR per day.
 
Roern has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for nine cycles already and she completely repaid the loans. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nhorn's Group

texts.en:
Nhom is 63 years old, widowed, and has one child. She lives in a rural village of the Banteay Meas district of Kampot Province. She is a rice farmer in the local and she also raises chickens and pigs and works for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 45 years, she can earn a daily income of approximately 12,000 KHR. She is able to save about 6,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Nhom is the leader of a three-member group. She requested her third loan from VisionFund, which she will use to build a latrine for her family. She hopes to have a decent latrine so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Ann Chaitanya Thakura Shg Group

texts.en:
The Group “Ann Chaitanya Thakura Shg” is composed of eleven members and is about to begin its first loan cycle with Peoples Forum. Bela, a 48-year old woman, is the secretary of the group who dreams of creating a better and more prosperous future. 

The owner of a weaving business, Bela has been creating traditional clothing since she was a child. Because Nayagarh, Odisha attracts tourists, Bela wants to have plenty of inventory on hand so that she can earn income to help support her family. Her biggest dream is to save money to build a house. She plans to use her loan to purchase a wide variety of threads with the goal of improving her weaving production.

The ladies of the group have improved their quality of life because of their increased knowledge about a variety of subjects. A portion of their monthly meetings is set aside for educational purposes. A Peoples Forum Loan Officer shares relevant and useful information with the ladies on a wide variety of subjects including business management, preventative health, nutrition, hygiene, self-esteem and women’s rights. The ladies learn how to use their loans most effectively as they learn about business planning, budgeting, accounting, marketing and customer service.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of threads with the goal of improving her weaving production.

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTIAGO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pollos, venta de coca, venta de golosinas, venta de papa, venta de refrescos, servicio de transporte, venta de ropa americana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de  su madre, ya que desde niña ella ayudaba en el negocio familiar, cuando tuvo su primer hijo decide tener un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de papa por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas, posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Santiago” Communal Association is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani Centro Focal. It is composed of 8 members and is directed by Rosa as President. The businesses that the members operate are varied, among them: selling chickens, coca, candy, potatoes, soft drinks, American clothing, plus transportation services.

The loan they wish to take out will benefit micro-enterprises, including one that Rosa is involved in. She reports that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. At present, she has a business selling potatoes, both regular and dehydrated. She also noted that she learned the business from her mother, since as a child, she helped her in the family business. When Rosa had her first child, she decided to start an independent business.

The loan that Rosa is now requesting is to increase her merchandise (by buying potatoes at wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale venders. Then she will sell it from her market stall. This type of work permits her to generate resources to help her family economically, since she lives with her life's partner and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes at wholesale for resale in the market.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина 22 летняя жительница городка Турсунзаде. Это не большой городок, там живут гостеприимные, добрые и вежливые жители. Парвина входит в число этих жителей. Она замужем и уже имеет детей. Парвина сама зарабатывает. Она берет заказы на шитье женской одежды. Парвина работает в этой сфере деятельности 2 года. Она любит свою работу и старается улучшить качество своей работы. На данный момент Парвина нуждается в новой компьютерной швейной машинке. Из-за нехватки средств она не может самостоятельно совершить покупку, и она приняла решение обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Parvina is 22 years old and she lives in Tursun-zoda, a small city whose residents are hospitable, kind and polite.  Parvina is one of these people.  She is married, with children already.  She also makes her own living.  She takes orders and sews women's dresses.  She has been involved in this type of activity for two years.  She likes her job and is eager to improve the quality of her work.  At the moment she needs a new computerized sewing machine, but she doesn't have the financial means to make that kind of purchase herself.  For this reason she has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Marvin De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Marvin habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, casado, padre de un hijo adolescente, el tiene su propio negocio es Pintor Automotriz y Enderezador desde hace muchos años, tiene la edad de 35 años.
Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de Materiales de construcción ya que quiere remodelar el taller que tiene, para prestar mejores servicios. gracias a este crédito los clientes podrán dejar sus vehículos con mayor confianza ya que tendrá mas seguridad y sus instrumentos de trabajo estarán bien resguardadas.
texts.en:
Marvin lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  He is married and is the father of an adolescent son.  He has his own business painting vehicles and fixing them, and he has been working in this field for several years.  He is 35 years old.  

This loan will be used to purchase construction materials in order to remodel his shop, which will allow him to offer better services.  Thanks to this loan his customers will be able to leave their vehicles with greater confidence since the shop will have better security and his tools will be safeguarded.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to remodel his shop to offer customers greater security.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business to maintain sales, so that she can continue to support her family through her income.

loans.name: Lord John

texts.en: Lord John is 36 years old and married with three children, and a resident of San Jose, Aurora. He operates a palay (rice) retail business in order to support his family, and the business is doing well. He was able to purchase materials needed for the business with his previous loan and the loan was repaid successfully. To improve the business, he recently took a new loan to buy more grains to sell. He will deliver his stocks of rice to other villages. He is now earning a bigger amount than usual and his ability to engage business is improving. He plans to buy a vehicle to be used for the business.

loans.use: to buy more grains to sell

loans.name: Rita De Jesus

texts.es: Rita de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chocobananos, charamuscas, gelatinas, etc. desde hace 8 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de guineos (bananos), diferentes frutas, azúcar, flan de sabores, leche, etc. y asi seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: Rita, 55, lives in her own house with her husband. He works in construction and helps with the household expenses. She dedicates herself to the preparation and sale of chocobananas, frozen treats and gelatin, etc. For the last 8 years, she's had many clients, especially her neighbors. With what she earns from her sales and the help from her husband, they are able to move forward. She is requesting a loan to buy bananas, different fruits, sugar, flavored flan, milk, etc., so she can be sure of moving ahead with her sales as this business is her only fountain of income.

loans.use: buy small bananas, different fruits, sugar, flavoured flan, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk wholesale.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like again to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, as well as to add frozen foods to sell at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ma.Elena dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general loan in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general loan for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Analyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Angelie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Angelie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, and school uniforms for her ready-to-wear clothing business.

Angelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants, and school uniforms.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie works hard to support her family. Elsie is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Monina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs. Monina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, gasoline, paint, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, gasoline, paint, wood, etc. for her business

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Florife has a trisikad (pedicab) transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy an additional trisikad.

Florife has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (pedicab).

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 43 years old, is married and has four children. For the past five years, Erlinda has operated a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 29 years old and married with one child.

Ailen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ailen has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ailen aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Liberty works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Liberty has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Liberty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Julieta has been in this business for two years now.

Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and married with ten children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general loan in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, and coffee.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 40 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general loan for 26 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, and coffee.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old and a widow with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and more.

Ana has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Tiofilo

texts.es:
Tiofilo de 58 años de edad, solamente estudio hasta 2º grado de educación básica, actualmente esta acompañado, son padres de 4 hijos pero ya no viven con ellos, su esposa solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar. Tiofilo se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño la siembra de diferentes granos entre ellos el maíz, maicillo y frijol, también trabaja como carpintero.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar madera, para elaborar algunos muebles que le han solicitado, El sueño de Tiofilo es fortalecer mas su negocio y cultivos para poder instalar una carpintería en su cantón con lo cual espera que genere ganancias satisfactorias que le permitan tener un futuro mejor tanto para él como para su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
Tiofilo is 58 years old and only visited school till the second grade of elementary school.

He is married and the couple has four children that do not live with them any longer. His wife takes care of the domestic tasks in their home.

Tiofilo has worked in agriculture from a very young age. His father taught him how to sow different seeds, including corn, millet and bean.
Tiofilo also works as a carpenter.

The loan he is asking for is to buy wood to construct some pieces of furniture that he has received orders for.
Tiofilo's dream is strengthening his business y cultivations so that he would be able to open a carpentry in his canton, from which he hopes he would be able to make satisfactory profit that would allow him to have a better future for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy wood to construct furniture that has been ordered

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 36 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Suyarqul

texts.ru: Суяркул - житель кишлака Турсунзода Шахристанского района. Суяркул  с детства любит животных. Он очень опытный скотовод. Суяркул  начиная с 2012 года сотрудничает с МДО Арванд. В настоящее время Суяркул  хочет  купить крупно - рогатый скот чтобы ухаживать,  откармливать  и продавать  на местном рынке. Он  с обоюдного  согласия семьи  обратился в Арванд  за поддержкой и подал заявку на кредит.  Суяркул заранее благодарен за своевременную поддержку.
texts.en: Suyarqul is a resident of the village of Tursunzoda in the Shahrituz region. He has loved animals since childhood and is very experienced in animal husbandry. He has been working with Arvand since 2012. At the moment he wants to buy cattle to look after, fatten and then sell at the local market. With the agreement of his family he has turned to Arvand for support and requested a loan. He thanks them in advance for the support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nyaminah

texts.en:
This is the story of Dasmin, son of Nyaminah :

My father works if there is a need of energy. My mother takes care of the household. My family has an uncertain economy. Besides that, our street is up and damaged. Homes are enough for families to reside in. I want to go to school here because I want to improve my family's income and the welfare of my family. I want a bright future so I can help my only sister and make my parents proud. I am grateful to the Kiva donors who have eased my parents' burden. Because of Kiva, I can study calmly. In this picture, Nyaminah and Dasmin his son.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Tasmiatun

texts.en:
This is the story of Lis, daughter of Tasmiatun:

My parents are just farm laborers and my father's side job is as a tapper. Their income is also erratic, sometimes 20,000 or less per day. Our life depends only on the results obtained from the tap.

My parents have 3 children. My parents must send their children to work. My brother just graduated from junior high school and now he is working in Brunei. Now my parents can only educate my brother up to junior high, because my family's financial situation is very difficult.

But now we regret that my parents do not send their children to school because my brother became a migrant worker and now my parents do not want to repeat the mistake again, so they are trying to further educate me and my brother. 
In the picture. Tasmiatun and Lis her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for educational fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 31-year-old divorced man. He has two kids. The members of his family are IDP (internally displaced persons) and live in an IDP settlement. He is living with his children in his parents’ house.  

To cover the family’s needs, Zaur has been raising seasonal fruits (apples, cherries, pears, apricots, etc.), vegetables (cucumbers, onions, greens) for 6 years. Then he sells the harvest at a local bazaar. His monthly earnings for this are 180 AZN.

Azerbaijan people have high demands for fresh fruits and vegetables. They use them in cooking national and delicious dishes. They prepare juice and jam for tea using fruits. Vegetables are used in cooking of such dishes as badimjhan dolmasi, pomidor dolmasi, etc.

Zaur’s earnings are too low to cover the family’s demands and the children’s education. Besides that, after the cold winter he lost part of the harvest. He needs to increase his income to help his family. He applied for 1,200 AZN to buy new fertilizers and fruit tree seeds. This will increase his harvest and income. 

Zaur hopes that one day all the problems will be away, so let’s help him to reach his aim.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and fruit tree seeds.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 28 years old. She is married and has two daughters. Her husband is a master. Fatma’s family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons), and they have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. She earns money raising fruits and vegetables and selling them at the local bazaar. The monthly income is 150 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat), and she has five years of skills in this area.

People’s demand for fruits and vegetables is very high. Every day, they use them in preparing different kinds of fruit juice and jam and vegetable salads. People are used to buying from private gardens because foods there are cheaper than in markets. 

She wants  to make her family’s life better; especially, she wants to provide for her daughters' future. Fatma applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to buy more fertilizers and fruit tree seeds to increase her income. This is her first loan; please support her.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and fruit tree seeds to increase her income.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal is a 47-year-old worker and widowed woman with two children, living in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has been a staff since 1995, earning $4.56 a day. One of her children is a garment factory worker earning $5 daily. Now Sophal would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work. This loan will help her child reduce traveling expenses. In the future, she is going to support her youngest child to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to commute to work.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de papa.
Ella es fuerte, luchadora, trabajadora, responsable, optimista y paciente. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en las ferias de la comunidad de ‘Sacaba’, un lugar caracterizado por la abundancia de restaurantes de comida típica y por su clima semi-tropícal.
Simona es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el quechua y habla un poco de español. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al transporte como taxi y algunos hijos, que ya son independientes pero siguen viviendo con ella, su casa está hecha de adobe y cuenta con el servicio de luz y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la venta de papa de las variedades; Puka Waycha, Aurora, Palta Chola, Puyjuni Imilla, que son variedades nuevas y de gran demanda por la población. Su comercio es la venta ambulante, ella se dirige acompañada de su esposo a las ferias de las provincias del lugar; cargada de varios costales de diferentes variedades, su esposo la lleva hasta el lugar, descarga los costales y vuelve por la noche para recoger lo que sobró. Este es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en veinte años de experiencia en el rubro. Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa.  Y desea realizar la conexión de agua potable a su baño y lavandería para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Es por esos motivos que Simona solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable a su domicilio y proporcionarle una vivienda segura a su familia.
texts.en:
Simona is 55 years old, married with independent children, and has a business selling potatoes. She's strong, resilient, hardworking, responsible, optimistic and patient. She is a traveling saleswoman, selling in different markets in the community of Sacaba, a place known for its many restaurants with typical local food and its semi-tropical climate. 

Simona is of dark complexion, medium build, with black long braided hair, and typical custom dress (hat, blanket and skirt). Her native language is Quechua, and she also speaks some Spanish. She lives with her husband who is a taxi driver, and with some of her children who are independent but still live with her. Her house is made of adobe and has light and well water. 

Her business is selling potatoes of the following varieties: Puka Waycha, Aurora, Palta Chola, and Puyjuni Imilla, which are new varieties that are in high demand. She travels with her product to sell, and goes with her husband to the markets around her community. She loads several bags of different varieties, her husband takes her to the market, she unloads her merchandise, and returns at night to pick up the leftovers. 

This is her second loan with the institution, and she has twenty years of experience in the industry. Her dream is finish construction on her home and to connect water to her bathroom and laundry for a better quality of life. It is for these reasons that Simona is requesting a loan for the water connection to her home, which will provide her with a safe home for her family.

loans.use: to connect potable water to her home, to provide a safe home to her family.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She is a poultry farmer. She has been in this business for six years and generates extra income from selling second-hand clothes in a rented shop. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feed and a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

She aspires to build more rental houses. She resides with her husband in their own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana en el 4to año de la carrera de enfermería de aquí en un año se ve ya egresada de la carrera que elegió.
Aspira a ejercer la profesión con responsabilidad y ética profesional e ir superando y creciendo como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Juliana is in her fourth year of study toward a degree in Nursing. She is a year away from graduating in the field of study that she chose. Juliana aspires to pursue her career with responsibility as an ethical professional. She also wants to excel and grow in this field.

Juliana is requesting this loan so that she can pay her fees, which would allow her to continue toward her goal.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Rogelio Alberto

texts.es:
Rogelio es un joven muy trabajador y luchador, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es abogado de profesión, actualmente está desempeñándose como Auxiliar de Garantías en una importante empresa, ha luchado mucho para conseguir un buen trabajo, porque quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarles todo lo mejor.
Debido a las fuertes ganas que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Rogelio tiene pensado utilizar el crédito para poder empezar a construir un cuarto en el segundo piso de su casa. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto su familia estará más tranquila y segura y así Rogelio continuará luchando para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a young hard worker and fighter that is very enthusiastic to get ahead, and he lives in Ica with his family. Rogelio is a lawyer, and he is currently serving as the Assistant of Guarantees in an important company. He has struggled very hard to get a good job because he wants to improve his family's quality of life and offer them all the best. 

Because of his strong desire to improve his family's quality of life, Rogelio has thought of using the loan to start constructing a room on the second floor of his home. He is very grateful to Kiva's lenders for their generosity. Rogelio want them to know that with this loan, his family will be more peaceful and secure. In this way, he can keep fighting to be able to get ahead.

loans.use: Construcción de un cuarto en el segundo piso de su casa.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 62, is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Benigno, her business partner, and has children who are already married. Violeta works hard to meet the family's daily household and personal needs and to save for their old age. 
  
Violeta has been a meat vendor for ten years.  She buys a pig and rents a place in her town market where she sells sliced meat by the kilo for a profit. She is well known to be an honest and nice lady and people prefer to buy from her. Violeta already has loyal and regular customers in the town market. She earns a minimum income of PHP 7,000 a month.

To help her improve her business, Violeta is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy a hog and sell the fresh sliced meat at the market.  She thanks God and you in advance for this will greatly help increase her sales and income to sustain her family in their daily needs and to help her grandchildren go to school.

Violeta aims to have her own stall at the town market and hopes that she will always have good customers.  She prays that she will always be strong and healthy, even in her old age. Violeta meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a hog to sell its meat.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 64 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Marietta has been in this business for 29 years.

In the future, Marietta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Erlinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Erlinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 15 years. Lorna earns more income from selling vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her business. Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina works hard to support her family. Merlina is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

Merlina has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Merlina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Esperanza successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Esperanza's business profile, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 37 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jonah requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonah has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a cafeteria. Eva is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish for her fish vending business to sell.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to bolster her capital and buy a large quantity of rice for resale in order to earn more so as to help provide for her family.

loans.name: Irma Mariela

texts.es:
Irma de 24 años de edad, está acompañada desde los 19 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos de 4 años de edad y 6 meses de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su pareja de vida es agricultor. Con ella viven únicamente sus hijos y su pareja y solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

Irma es comerciante, tiene 4 años de vender en un puesto ubicado en una zona céntrica en el mercado de la comunidad en el que vende pan y tamales, los tamales los hace ella pero el pan lo elabora otra persona y ella lo vende por lo que obtiene una comisión por la venta. También tiene un  negocio en el que vende de manera ambulante en que vende antojitos como pasteles de carne y panes con pollo, recorre cerca de 1km. Su horario de trabajo es de las  8:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm 

EL préstamo será utilizado para cancelar una deuda, ella vende productos de revista y tiene que cancelar el pedido que hizo para vender y no tiene el dinero suficiente para cancelar porque sus cliente tampoco le han cancelado a ella. Irma  espera que con su negocio de  a sus hijos lo que necesiten y piensa mejorar contando siempre con la ayuda de CrediCampo.
texts.en:
Irma, 24, has had a partner for 19 years and has two children, one aged 4 years and the other 6 months. She studied until grade 9. Her partner is a farmer. She lives with her children and partner and only her children depend on her.

Irma is a businesswoman. She's been selling bread and tamales at a kiosk located in the central area of the community market for four years. She prepares the tamales but the bread is made by someone else and she gets a commission for selling it. She also runs a business as an ambulant salesperson, selling snacks, like meat pastries and bread with chicken; her route is almost one kilometer. Her work schedule is 8:00 am to 3:00 pm.

The loan will be used to pay off a debt. She sells products by mail order and has to pay for the product order she made, which she will then sell, and doesn't have the funds necessary because her client hasn't paid her yet. Irma hopes that her business will allow her to provide her children with what they need and she'd like to improve her business with the help of CrediCampo.

loans.use: pay off a  debt.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Don Marco, tiene 52 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y reside en una aldea del Municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos y lleva 15 años cultivando café. El café que produce lo vende en oro en la misma zona.  Don Marco ha solicitado un préstamo por 7,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes para aplicar a su finca de café, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la cosecha. El plan que tiene es continuar con la siembra de café y ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mr. Marco is 52 years old; he is married and has 5 children. He lives in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has dedicated his life to growing basic grains and has 15 years of growing coffee. The coffee he grows he sells in parchment form in the same area. 

Mr. Marco has requested a loan for 7,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers to apply to his coffee plantation. This investment will help him improve his harvest. His plan is to continue growing coffee and to help his children finish their studies.

loans.use: buy fertilizers to apply to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Adzua

texts.fr: Adzua née à KUMA Apoti, âgé de 55 ans est  vendeuse de gâteau à l’école Amitié. Elle est divorcé et mère d’un  enfant. Adzua  réside à Adidogomé . Elle a un niveau primaire. Adzua  sollicite  ce prêt pour le commerce des mais, qu’elle approvisionne à assiyéyé .Madame Adzua  prétend leur épanouissement de sa vie et son enfant  par l’épargne de ses revenus
texts.en:
Adzua was born in Kuma Apoti. She is 55 years old and sells cakes at the Amitié school. She is divorced and the mother of one child.

Adzua lives in Adidogomé. She has a primary level education.

Adzua is requesting this loan to purchase corn, which she procures in Assiyéyé. Adzua provides for her daily needs and those of her child through the savings of her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of corn

loans.name: Koudjo

texts.fr: Koudjo née à Tovegan, âgé de 42 ans est électricien et vend aussi les moutons, chèvres et poulets. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Koudjo réside à Adidogomé  . Il a un niveau d’étude secondaire.Koudjo sollicite  ce prêt pour le commerce des matériaux de construction, qu’il approvisionne à assivito deux fois par mois .Mr Koudjo prétend avoir son terrain pour la construction de sa maison par l’épargne de ses revenus
texts.en: Koudjo was born in Tovegan, is 42 years old, and is an electrician, who also sells sheep, goats, and chickens. He is a married father of three. Koudjo lives in Adidogomé. He has a high school education. Koudjo is seeking this loan for his business in construction materials, which he stocks up on in Assivito twice a month. Mr. Koudjo claims to have the land for the construction of his house by saving his profits.

loans.use: to buy two rolls of wire, three rolls of pipes, and 10 boxes of switches

loans.name: Yeesis Maryory

texts.es:
Yeesis de 28 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, tuvo la oportunidad de preparase académicamente, es una profesional graduada en técnico en enfermería. Y siempre le colabora a su madre en los oficios del hogar.

Actualmente Yeesis está desempleada, trabajó de manera interina en una clínica privada de su comunidad; cuando alguien necesita de sus servicios no lo piensa dos veces para ayudar a las personas. Por el momento elabora antojitos, como pasteles de carne, yuca frita, enchiladas, enredos y demás para ayudar a su madre con el sostenimiento del hogar.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar instrumentos musicales, un bombo y un redoblante, con ello apoyará al equipo de futbol de su comunidad ya que a Yeesis siempre le ha gustado participar en actividades sociales que contribuyan al bienestar de los jóvenes y niños de su comunidad.

El sueño que Yeesis mas añora es conseguir un trabajo estable para ejercer su profesión y ayudar a las personas como siempre lo quiso, además algún día formar una familia.
texts.en:
Yeesis is 28 years old, single, and has no children. She had the opportunity to study, and graduated as a nurse. She always helps her mother out with the household chores.

Yeesis is currently unemployed. She worked in a private clinic in her town on an interim basis. When someone needs her services she doesn't think twice about helping them. At the moment, she makes snacks such as meat pies, fried yucca, enchiladas, pastries and other items to help her mother to maintain the home.

She will use the loan to buy musical instruments, a bass drum and a snare drum, to support her local football team. Yeesis has always enjoyed taking part in social activities that contribute to the well-being of the young people and children in her town.

Yeesis's biggest dream is to get a stable job to exercise her profession and help people as she always wanted. She also wants to start a family one day.

loans.use: to buy a bass drum and a snare drum.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo 42 ans, née à Ekpla AGOU est revendeuse d’alimentation à domicile depuis 2007 ;situé Adidogomé . Elle a un niveau secondaire, mariée mère de cinq enfantsAdzo approvisionne à assiyéyé deux fois par mois ; elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter la taille de son commerce. Adzo pense à l’éducation supérieure et à l’épanouissement de ses enfants par l’épargne de son revenu.
texts.en: Adzo is 42 years old. She was born in Ekpla.  [Adzo] has been selling food items out of her home in Adidogomé since 2007. She has finished secondary school. She is married and is the mother of five. Adzo stocks up in Assiyéyé twice a month. She is seeking this loan in order to expand her business. Adzo is thinking about college education and future opportunities for her children, which is why she is using her revenues to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy five baskets of tomatoes, eight baskets of okra and 10 boxes of pepper.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda has always dreamed of having a firewood stall near her house to support her two children. 

She recently applied for this loan to purchase of timber for making firewood to support her children. She is on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase timber for making firewood to support her children

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 46-year-old widow with four children. She has an existing "sari-sari" (variety) store and she has decided to build a space for her videoke (video karaoke) sound system for her customers. This way she can invite more customers to sing on her videoke sound system. 

She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative three years ago, and she is very helpful and cooperative to her fellow group members. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP and this loan is intended for purchasing additional construction materials for her videoke sound system location. Her future plan is for her family to live a comfortable life and to be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials for her videoke space

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support his daughter in expenses related to her Bachelor's degree in commercial engineering

loans.name: Llowelyne

texts.en: Llowelyne earns a living from selling goods in her retail store with the helped of  her husband. She has been doing this for many years and she earns well and was able to improve the business. Her earnings go towards their daily family expenditures and she had her savings for the future education of her children. To have more stock to offer, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy more grocery goods for her retail store in order to raise more profits. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing better education to her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn owns and operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by operating a tailoring and gown rental business. She has a van unit which she is using for a transportation service.

Now Jocelyn would like to take a new loan to improve her services. She is requesting an amount of PHP 30,000 to buy more beauty and hair products like straightening treatments and other products needed in her business. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase materials needed in her tailoring business.

In the future, Jocelyn wants to make expansions in her business and likewise buy more units and supplies needed to improve her services. She also hopes that her family will always be free from any sickness. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and hair products needed in her salon and to purchase materials needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. Carmen is married, and has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, paints, nails, bamboo, etc for the maintenance of her boarding house business. Carmen has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Carmen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, paints, nails, bamboo, etc for the maintenance of her boarding house business

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is 47 years old and married, with three children. With three children currently in school, Cresenciana works very hard to provide for them.

Cresenciana runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like bread, coffee, canned goods, sugar, and chocolate drinks.

Cresenciana has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items, such as bread, coffee, canned goods, sugar, and chocolate drinks. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cresenciana would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like bread, coffee, canned goods, sugar, and chocolate drinks.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Valentina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling herbal medicine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Valentina is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of herbal medicines to offer for sale.

Valentina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of herbal medicines to offer for sale.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Kim Adrian (the student and son of Lilibeth) is 19 years old and is the youngest of the four children in the family. His mother, Lilibeth (member of NWTF and mother of Kim Adrian) supports the family through her business raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Kim Adrian is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accountancy and is currently in the 2nd of this 4-year course.

Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 4000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Kim Adrian for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Kim Adrian plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Pebrita

texts.en:
Pebrita, 56 years old, is married and has eight children, one of them still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Pebrita has operated a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

Pebrita has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her stand. Pebrita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jovita works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Jovita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es:
Ana de 31 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y estudio hasta bachillerato. Actualmente vive con su madre y 2 hermanas. Ana es quien ha tomado las riendas de su hogar, lastimosamente sus ingresos no son suficientes para los gastos. Solo la mamá y dos hermanas viven con ella.

Ana tiene dos trabajos, ocasionalmente trabaja en una imprenta de su comunidad que pertenece a una familia muy respetada y en sus días libres vende antojitos típicos como enchiladas, nuégados, pastelitos de carne y papa, yuca frita y demás, para luego salir a vender a las 2:00 pm en la zona, recorre alrededor de 1 km. para vender su mercadería y luego regresa a su casa cerca de las 7:00pm.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 12 quintales de maíz para tener de reserva para su negocio, además apoyara a sus dos hermanas con los gastos de graduación. Ana espera que sus hermanas sean personas de bien y se y terminen de prepararse pues comenta que lo mas duro ya paso y seguirá apoyándolas con la ayuda de CrediCampo.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old, single, does not have children and completed secondary school.
At the moment she lives together with her mother and two sisters. Ana has taken charge of the household but sadly her income is not sufficient to cover their costs. Only the mother and two sisters live with her.

Ana has two jobs. Occasionally she works in a printing office in her community that belongs to a much respected family.
On her days off she sells typical snacks such as enchiladas, sweet fried dumplings, meat and potato pies, fried yuca and such. She starts selling at 2pm and covers around 1km of distance to sell her goods and returns home around 7pm.

The loan will be used to buy 12 quintal of corn as a reserve for her business. It would also help her two sisters with their graduating costs.

Ana hopes her sisters will be good and finish their preparations as she believes that the hardest part is already over.
She will continue supporting them with the help of CrediCampo.

loans.use: to buy 12 quintals of corn

loans.name: Kantabausuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Kantabausuni Shg is a group made up of 11 hardworking, friendly, responsible and honest women who are all from the same community in Koraput district. Here, some people left to work in other cities in order to offer a better future to their families, and others took the risk of opening their own businesses. 

Ambika is a joyful, charismatic and honest young woman. She is 32 years old, has three children and lives with her husband and her children.

Ambika started selling vegetables in the near market six years ago, and today has a shop in the center of the market. With her earnings, she helps her husband with household expenses, covers her personal needs, and invests in more stock. Ambika works every day from 10:00 am until 8:00 pm in her shop, which is set up in near the market. Her husband helps by delivering her lunch and snacks at the shop. 

“Thank you Peoples Forum for offering me the great opportunity to be your client “, says Ambika, adding that with this loan she will buy different types of vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy different types of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susan is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, cooking oil and other ingredients.

Susan has been in this business for three years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: José Ismael

texts.es:
José de 65 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, su estudios culminaron hasta sexto grado, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad, su familia esta con formada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos ya que sus hijos tienen su hogar aparte y solo una hija vive con él.

José se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana junto a su esposa en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja ordeñando las vacas que posee.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar tres vacas que le generaran una buena producción de leche para empezar a elaborar lácteos como queso, crema, requesón, etc. y que le ayudara al incremento de sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia 

José planea en un futuro  con ayuda de otro crédito incursionar en la siembra de jícama con el involucramiento de su esposa podrá obtener un mejor ingreso para su sustento.
texts.en:
José, 65 years old, works in agriculture and cattle-raising. His studies ended at the sixth grade. He grew up with his parents, who taught him this work. His family consists of his wife, who supports him with the housework since his children have a separate home only one daughter lives with him.

José gets up at 5:00 am to go to work the morning with his wife on the plot of land that they rent. For the rest of the day he works getting his cows in order.

The loan he is requesting is to buy three cows that will produce a good supply of milk for him in order to begin making dairy products such as cheese, cream, requesón (a spreadable cheese), etc. It will help him increase his income to sustain his family.

In the future, with the help of another loan José plans on making a foray into planting jicama. With his wife's support he will be able to earn a better income to sustain them.

loans.use: to buy three cows that will produce a good supply of milk for him in order to begin making dairy products such as cheese, cream, requesón (a spreadable cheese), etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 50 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsie has been in this business for 11 years, and she earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Judith  Melany

texts.es: Judith de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, Judith esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por myor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Judith is 37 years old and lives in a house of her own with her husband and four children.

She has been selling tortillas for the past ten years. Her business is located in her home and she has many clients, especially her neighbors.

Judith is asking for a loan to buy corn at wholesale and to buy calcium hydroxide to continue expanding her tortilla production and in this way make more profit to increase her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and calcium hydroxide

loans.name: Oscar Adalberto

texts.es: Oscar de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, desde hace varios años que el se dedica a la venta de jugos, gaseosas, refrescos, agua, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes ya establecidos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos para surtir su negocio y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Oscar is 51 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He has made a living selling juices, fizzy drinks, soft drinks, water, and other items for a number of years. His business is located in his home ad he has a lot of regular customers already. He is requesting a loan to buy more products to stock his business and in this way, boost his profits.

loans.use: to buy juices, fizzy drinks, soft drinks, water, etc.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es: Natividad de 51  años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles, esta  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Natividad, 51, lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. He has a carpentry shop in which he builds and sells a variety of beautiful, fine furniture. He has many years experience with this business; many people prefer his work as he offers good quality and good prices. He's requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business by buying wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds and more items that will result in attracting more clients in order to achieve his objective of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds and more items.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Carmen

texts.es: Consuelo de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared en la entrada y repellando la pared que muestra en la fotografía pero con no tiene suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito y poder comprar cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 58 years old. She lives in her own house with her son. She works as an employee for a private company. 

She can cover some of the household expenses with the money she gets from her job. She wants to improve her house by building a wall at the entrance, and plastering the wall shown in the picture. 

She doesn't have enough money to do this, so that's the reason why she's asking for a loan, and to be able to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, and to pay for the labor to have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, laminate, ceramic flooring, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза добросовестная женщина. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды более 5 лет. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Фируза очень трудолюбивая. Она обратилась в ИМОН за займом, так как ее сын учится в университете, и она должна оплатить за его учебный договор. Фируза запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Firuza is a conscientious woman. She has been making women's clothes for five years from home. She is very hard working. Firuza turned to IMON for a loan so she can pay her son's college tuition. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay tuition of her son

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
From Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Jacquiline, 28, earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business, which has operated for two years now. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. 

Now, Jacquiline wants to live comfortably with a house of good roofing and walling, supported by her loan to purchase construction materials for house renovation to provide a comfortable living space for the family. Jacquiline hopes to live a better life with her family and have an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house renovation to provide a comfortable living space for the family

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en: Marvin is 32 years old, married, and has children to support. He lives with his family in Peñablanca, where he manages a small business to earn a living. With his wife, Marvin sells a variety of merchandise such as fruits and vegetables. However, their earnings are sometimes not sufficient to support their daily expenditures. Therefore, Marvin is requesting for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more peanut butter, vegetables, and fruits to sell. He hopes that this loan will help improve their sales and gain good profits for the family.

loans.use: to buy more peanut butter, vegetables, and fruits to sell

loans.name: Luisa María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, una hija  aún vive con ella junto a su familia. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Luisa es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante, ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, vende helados, jugos y bebidas de toda clase,  sus ventas son muy buenas ya que su casa está muy cerca de una cancha, lugar donde todos los días llegan muchas personas a hacer deporte y quienes consumen sus productos,  lleva más de 6 años con este negocio. 
Este crédito es para surtir aún más su negocio, va a comprar jugos, helados y colas. Esta casi desde el inicio en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que le brinda la institución como el servicio de médicos y medicinas gratis. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “For A New Dawn” Credit Group meets each 15 days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisan crafts, recognized nationally and internationally. This is where they make the famous “Panama hats” from the local “toquilla” straw.

Here lives Luisa, who is 68 years old, married, and from this union sprang three children, all adults now. One, a girl, still lives with Luisa and her family. Luisa's husband is a brick mason.

Luisa is a woman who has always liked to work in order to get ahead. She has a small business in her house, selling ice cream, juices and drinks of all types. Her sales are very good, since her house is very close to an athletic field where every day, many people come to play sports and they consume her products. She has had her business for more than six years.
