This loan is to expand supplies for her business. She will purchase juices, ice cream and colas. Luisa is a new member in the Loan Group and she likes it for its benefits and the help the institution offers, such as medical services and free medicines.

Her dreams are to forge ahead.

loans.use: to buy juices, ice cream, and colas to sell from her home.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Mercy has been in this business for 10 years. Mercy earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loads.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items to sell, like noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more linen to make mats for her mat-weaving business.

Arlen has been in this business for 3 years. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more linen to make mats

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
Mitchelle is 40 years old and married with four children,two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mitchelle has a business selling religious items in the Philippines. Mitchelle requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of religious articles to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mitchelle has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mitchelle would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of religious articles to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business.

Lilia has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Soledad (a student and daughter of Virginia) is 25 years old and is the third of ten children in the family. Her mother, Virginia (member of NWTF), supports the family through her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Soledad is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in her fourth year of this four-year course.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 15,000 to pay the tuition fee of her daughter Soledad for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When she graduates, Soledad plans to be gainfully employed so she can help to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Floredelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 51 years old and married with three children.

Flordelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries. Flordelina has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from farming rice for more than 10 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Flordelina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and to pay for laborers’ salaries for land preparation.

Merlinda has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas works hard to support her family. Leonidas is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat like paints, wood, bamboo, and related tools.

Leonidas has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Leonidas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat like paints, wood, and bamboo

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Feliza has been in this business for 10 years. Feliza earns more income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Feliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba, 60 years old, is married. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past six years, Melba has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future Melba would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ermetania

texts.en:
Ermetania is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like beans, fish, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Ermetania has been in this business for 30 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Ermetania has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like beans, fish, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food production/vending business
